review: Red robin is always one of my fav restaurants to get fries and burgers.
The Burgers are fantastic! Our server was okay could have been a bit nicer. But overall loved it!
Only had so-so service when we ate there about 2 weeks ago.  The food was good and I hate parking at the mall (OK, I hate malls....) but it's good for what it is.

slow, unfriendly and dirty restaurant----  however after I e-mailed a complaint to red robin they promptly forwarded the e-mail and the manager contacted me and apologized and invited us to come back and try it again, and we will. fingers crossed the standards are raised to be like most of the other red robins we have tried. update:  we went back and tried this restaurant again after speaking to the manager and it was a MUCH more pleasant experience!  If nothing else, A.J. is a superb manager!  full review here:
NO MORE SALMON & CHIPS!!! My favorite thing on the menu :(

Bottomless Root Beer Float -- those are 4 glorious words!  That's right peeps!  An all you can eat/drink root beer floats!  And, hold on...it's only $3.19.  Are you kidding me?  The other thing I love is that it is technically considered a "beverage", and not a "dessert".  OMG - OMG - OMG!   MENU SELECTIONS --- Of course, they feature burgers and great steak fries (all you can eat with each order), but Red Robin's really do have a nice variety of a little everything: salads, pastas, soups, and more.  Selected by yours truly on this visit, a Patty Melt ( ). FRENCH FRIES TIP OF THE DAY --- Eat half of your burger to consume even more fries, and take the other half to go.    HAPPY HOUR (M-F; 3pm-6pm; 8pm-close) --- Drinks, plenty to choose from, ranging from $2.50 to $4.50 ( ), and appetizers ranging from $3-$7 ( ). SAPPY ADVERTISING --- surrounded everywhere, some funny, some not, and some just lame.  C'mon, new shrimp tacos look/sound good - but you don't LURE shrimp!  ( ), you lay down a net and pull it up silly!  Here's a link on how to catch shrimp:  .  If English is your second language, a 'shrimp lure' is used to catch certain fish. ======================= = UNIQUE LOCATION INFO = ======================= SERVICE --- Theresa, my server on this day (3/29/2012), was nice, but management had her way overloaded.  So much so, she felt she has to apologize to each new table, "sorry, i am the only one over here."  She was also the hostess that greeted me, and walked me over to my table...that's way too much ground to cover for this larger than usual location. COOL FEATURES --- Nice outdoor patio area with 15 tables, and heat lamps. LESS THAN COOL PARKING --- A little difficult to park anywhere close to the front door -- you should be prepared to walk a bit or have luck on your side.  If you prefer to valet park, no problem, that's the feature here of this mall, which gets strong consideration at peak times. CONCLUSION --- It was just 'alright'.  With all the other choices out there, I don't think I will be running back here anytime soon.  Well, I lied...I will visit for the Root Beer Float.  Can this kind of float be a valid entry into the Rose Bowl Parade?  Can I be entered if I eat/drink too many of them?

Gross Gross and Gross. I came here on Saturday & they weren't very crowded. We were seated right away but had to get up about 10 minutes later to ask someone to bring us some water. Once our server finally arrived, we were overjoyed. However, the service was slow, less than mediocre and the food was disgusting (I had the Baja shrimp tacos).  The only thing that was tasty and worthwhile was the Bottomless Strawberry Lemonade -- it was sooo delicious but I had to keep asking for refills which was pretty annoying. The server wouldnt even take trash off the table until we asked her. AWFUL! UGH, I wont be eating here again. But I'll take a lemonade TO-GO though!

I enjoy the nachos off the appetizer section of the menu. The food is tasty, I love that their fries are bottomless. They're delicious! Average food, average service. Nothing special, but nothing bad.

I love Red Robin and all their different burgers, and this locations food is as good as any. The problem is it can get very busy and when it is busy, the service suffers. Last weekend we visited this location and it took 30 minutes for us to receive our drinks after we ordered them. We were getting up to leave when we saw the waitress come with our drinks so we sat back down. We mentioned this to the manager and he took the drinks off of our bill, which was nice. Had he not done anything about it I would have gave them a 2, and if the drinks came out in a reasonable amount of time, I would have gave them a 4.

Well,Bottomless Root Beer Float -- those are 4 glorious words!  That's right peeps!  An all you can eat/drink root beer floats!  And, hold on...it's only $3.19.  Are you kidding me?  The other thing I love is that it is  FAST SERVICE GOOD FOOD HOT ON THE SPOT

I've been coming to the South Bay Galleria since I was a pre-teen (oh gosh that was so long ago..waaa) and would always see Red Robin, but never went in. My co-worker Denise asked me to lunch and was surprised when I told her that I had never been before. Located next door to Nordstroms, we were greeted by two friendly employees. We got there pretty early so it wasn't crowded and we had choice of where we sat. Red Robin is known for the different types of burgers they offer. Having gone to various burger places (The Counter, Fat Burger and Ruby's to name a few), I would've expected their selection of burgers would have been a bit bigger. If you look at the menu there are a lot of burgers listed, however many of them have similar ingredients so there wasn't that much of a distinction among some of them. Not a deal breaker, but an observation to note.  I ordered a raspberry limeade drink mixed with sprite. It was really good, I may have to make a home version of it because it was really tasty. The other good thing about this drink is that it fell into the "refillable" category which was a plus. Most restaurants that have specialty drinks will let you have refills without having to pay. The only drinks deemed refillable are the sodas, teas and lemonades so this was a pleasant surprise.  For food I got a patty melt. I must say it is really hard to find good patty melts these days. It just didn't have that "patty melt" taste for me. The bottomless fries were pretty good, however ours seemed like they'd been sitting under a heat lamp rather than being freshly cooked. And since we were one of the first in the restaurant, you wouldn't think that we'd have warm fries, but rather hot out the fryer.  Red Robin has a full bar area and also have televisions throughout the bar area so I would think it would be a nice place to catch a game or come in for happy hour.  The ambiance was pretty nice and our server was really attentive, however it wasn't a memorable enough place for me to want to return. I'll stick to Ruby's!

One word: DISAPPOINTING!  It's been ages since I've eaten at Red Robin and I happened to crave a burger and I live right by it..so why not? I ordered a Buzallo Style Tavern Double, my friends ordered Cantina Jack Style Tavern Double and Burnin' Love.  Being the kind of girl who loves juicy burgers with some pink so I asked for it  to be medium; in fact we all ordered medium. Well, mine came out well-done!! They brought another one and it was a little better but not juicy or pink. The tavern doubles had really thin meat patties and the Burnin' Love was okay--it came out really pink--medium rare! The flavors weren't so bad but the patties felt like it came from a fast food joint. On top of that the service was only subpar. We had to wave several times to get her attention.  Lately, with the rise of so many burger joints, Red Robin does not even compare.  Sorry, you used to be good but you don't meet my expectations anymore.

How can you not be a fan when they have endless steak fries? We had to wait a really long time, much longer than the expected wait time the hostess gave us, so they gave us a free appetizer.  Overall the service was really great (other than the waiting).  Our server was a really sweet gal named Tully :)

Love the Food and the service.  Come and see Jake the best bartender you'll meet.  The riblets and mac n cheese is yummy.  I really love the garlic fries and sweet potato fries.  Been coming here for years!

LOVE THE FOOD SERVICE IS THE SHIZZ I always forget to bring one of my moms big purses to smuggle the BOTTOMLESS fries out, but oh well. Burgers are good, the Strawberry Lemonade..HAS REAL LIVE STRAWBERRIES IN IT aaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhh it can also induce a minor drug habit, since it's equivalent to cocaine, that's how damn good it is, so be careful.

I am so appalled at the quality of service. First the hostess tells us to do self seating..we are curious as to why when there were plenty of booths available on the other side. We ask, she says "I just don't know if anything is available" we then say we will wait.. Within two minutes we are seated. The hostess was clearly lazy and service went down hill from our waiter to the food. Horrible customer service. I have been going to different Red Robin's for years..this was really the worst service and I wish I never stepped foot in there.

went in on saturday 7/28/12 at about 2. was told that there was no wait in the bar area. ok. sat in the bar area with waiters walking by us and even looking at us for 10 minutes. no one gave us a menu. no one acknowledged we were there. if they said "we'll be with you in one minute" we would have stayed. we got up and walked out. probably no one even noticed. red robin, i used to frequent your establishment in oregon. I WILL NEVER RETURN. PERIOD. old guy who waiters there needs to be told "if a customer comes in and sits down and makes eye contact with you and you see they have not been waited on, don't wait 10 minutes hoping someone else will wait on them."

I used to get lunch from here, not anymore. What is up with the new "healthy" menu? They took out chili!? what?! i know there were fattening things on there, but come on, i can also choose to do extra cardio.  :(
The food is okay. The service was good. The restaurant is clean. Its a nice place to go to after walking around the mall for a while especially if you have kids

Back for the free birthday burger--the one with Swiss cheese and sauteed 'shrooms.  It was delicious and cooked exactly the way I asked--medium.  The service was fine; no problems there; however, I took one star off for the following: -  Bench seats had crumbs on them -  They were rather stingy on the fries (actually, that may be a good thing) -  I guess they're conserving napkins 'cause they only give you one unless you ask -  Given the messiness of the burgers you would expect one of those little packages of moist towelettes but no -  I wish I'd remembered to ask for a plate; I hate those baskets b/c I never want to set my burger down on top of the fries and get them all soggy so I end up holding the burger during the entire lunch

I regret choosing Red Robin over Island Burgers to eat dinner at.  It should have been a tall tail sign that we made the wrong choice when the restaurant is pretty empty at 7:45 PM.   Upon entering, we saw several tables that were littered with the previous diner's cups, utensils, and baskets (food is served in a basket).  After we were seated a waitress was prompt in taking our food and beverage order, but extremely slow in bring out our drinks.  In fact, our drinks came out at the same time our food did.   To further emphasize our wrong decision on where to eat at, the person that served our food said, "it's really slow here tonight."  Well, if it's that slow, then why didn't you take the initiative to clean the dirty tables rather than stand around the bar area and watch television?   Eventually our waitress came back around and asked if we wanted refills on our beverages and more fries.  I wonder what gave her the impression we would like a refill, us sipping on a straw to obtain the last bit of melted ice from the bottom of our cups?  Plus, how are you supposed to enjoy a burger without fries?  On the plus side, the burger was cooked well and had a lot of flavor. After what seemed to be an eternity of starring at dirty tables and staff standing around the bar area, which was actually 15 minutes, we still haven't received our refills.  At that point, we wanted neither and just wanted to get out of there.  I was impossible to get the attention of anybody, so we had to go to the front counter to ask for our check. I guess it was evident we weren't satisfied with our service, so the hostess retrieved the manager to ask about our experience.  We explained to her our complaints and issues regarding the service and she apologized.  It wasn't until she actually looked around the restaurant for herself and realized we weren't exaggerating how dirty the restaurant looked.   If you're contemplating on where to eat while you're at the South Bay Galleria, consider Island Burgers or California Pizza Kitchen.  You don't want to leave a restaurant with regret and remorse, but a satisfied pallet and tantalized taste buds.

I must say for being a chain burger restaurant, Red Robin puts out some pretty good burgers. I'm going to start off by saying that I can't believe they don't have the open faced chili burger anymore. It was so flavorful and amazing! Okay now time to move on... Burnin' love burger: Cayenne seasoned patty, jalapeños, pepper jack, spicy salsa, tomatoes, lettuce, chipotle mayo, all served on a jalapeño bun. YESSSS! I love spicy and this burger is perfect! It gives enough heat to make you break a sweat and has flavors jumping all throughout your mouth! Very good burger!  Freckled lemonade: Who doesn't love strawberry lemonade? Sweet sugary strawberries mixed with Minute Maid lemonade. PERFECT on a hot summer day! If you're not hungry just come here for this!  I knocked off a point just because the wait for the food can sometimes be pretty long even when they aren't that busy. Last time I waited around 35 minutes before my burger came out so I was a grumpy, hungry customer by the time it came out!

I've been coming to this location most of my life and I've always had a great experience. This is the first time that I've ordered to go and I must say, Janettee is the most wonderful server I've ever had the privilege to be served by! She is the most sweetest lady on this planet! If you ever plan to make a to go order from this location, ask for Janettee. Thank you so much Janettee!

I really like this place because of their BOTTOMLESS GARLIC FRIES (you'll have to ask for them, $1.50 more, but worth it!) and their new ideas for burgers every now and then. I'm really writing this review because the manager here, Nicole, was nice enough to comp us one of burgers when my Red Rewards card wasn't working. Favorites: A.1. Peppercorn Burger 5/5 Royal Red Robin Burger 4/5 BOTTOMLESS Garlic Fries 4/5 Poppyseed Honey Mustard Sauce 4/5

The worst sever ever!  She is LUCKY to have gotten a tip. Thanks to Isiah from Mexico, he  saved her fat ass! Luckily, I was with a few Ppl  from abroad and did not want to go gangsta on this idiotic server. The burgers are not even comparable to Oh Burger,  I hop, Wendy's , Carl Jr.  or Fat Burger! Best deal is to buy the 6.99 burger cause the 8.99 is only a hair strand bigger.  The worst onion rings in the world,  greasy, and small. The sweet potatoes fries  were like Burger king SP fries,  which really sucks! The atmosphere was friendly at the entrance and thecashier  Chris and Mgr. Isiah, Robin was cool, but the assigned served sucked with a  capital S.  If ur gonna serve mediocre burgers for 9,00  at least get decent servers .

I came with a friend and I think this place is not really an experience for friends. I think this place is for lovers or date. for the type of food I got. I could have gone somewhere much cheaper and enjoyed myself more. It was a good experience so I can say I have done it. I will say that the cheese appetizer was the best part. Say I was walking out I realized they have a happy hours that was really reasonable with the cheese fondue. I will come back for that.

I don't get to make it to Red Robins often but in the past my experience has been good...until I ordered the BOCA Vegan Burger.  I was soooo hungry so when my rubbery pattie on wheat bread came, I chomped down as much as I could but the burger had no taste at all.  Only the spicy mustard was dressing up the flavor. So the evening time comes, and that BOCA burger is still on my stomach.  I drank some rasberry tea and it didn't help.  Then I drank some of my Senekot tea and that was the beginning of the end...I threw up from 9:30 p.m. Sunday to 5:30 a.m. Monday.  Keep in mind, the throw up of the food was is in the first two rounds, the rest was that nothing throw up and very painful each time. I don't know what was in that burger, but for sure, I thought I was going to meet my maker.  If it wasn't for my husband buying me some Nausea medication, I don't know how long I would have been throwing up.  Needless to say, not everything that appears healthy is good for you.  So long Red Robbins, it was good while it lasted, but I am shell shocked as a result.   P.S.  Lost 3 pounds as a result in less than 24 hours.

came for a couple drinks since we were still early for our movie. nice bartender dude and they had a Clos du Bois cabernet available. we got that fudgy cake thing too for our choco/sugar fix. we probably won't be back for food. but, overall, its and okay spot.

Lots of seating and conveniently located within the Galleria Mall. RR has better fries than most other places and even though they don't have a huge selection of beers they do have one of my favorite beers.
Decent food, great drinks. Family friendly.

This is an awesome burger restaurant. Not only do you get the option to have your meat as you want it, but there's a variety of buns to choose from. If that wasn't all, the fries are bottomless. I suggest eating them with some campfire sauce; which is a modified version of barbeque sauce. Lastly, the service was relatively average so I got nothing to complain about here.

This is my usual Red Robin location - it's never too crowded so it's great! I've never really had any problem with food/staff/parking here. I usually like to get Banzai Burger - with pineapple and BBQ sauce in my burger with unlimited fries! I've had their wraps in the past. They are really really yummy, too!

I came here for the first time over the summer... honestly not much to say (both in a good and bad way). The fries & seasoning are pretty good! The burgers are mediocre, but still on the good side. I tried the blue cheese burger there (I get blue cheese burgers wherever) - a bit expensive for a burger, but if you're looking to try something new, this might be a good spot.

This red Robin is good but not as good as the other one at Lakewood mall. The only reason why is because the waiters here aren't as nice as the one's over there. Lakewood red Robin delivers the best customer service that I ever received. The food taste the same so no complaint about that.

I had the Red Tavern Double Burger with fries. Burger was amazingly good, but 3 days later, I can still taste it no matter how much I brush my teeth!  Fries were ok, but I could do without the seasoned salt they put on them. In fact, they had a huge bottle of seasoned salt on the table so i don't know why they put them on the fries for you...Food was served prompt and hot when it arrived to my table. Server was nice, but he reached over this ledge they had instead of walking around and putting the food on the table. I'd go here again.
Best bartender in the south bay since it opened and great staff and great burgers and salads

Not like any other Red Robin I've ever been to. Definitely the least impressive I've ever been in. Don't go out of your way to eat here. The only way I'll ever go back is if I just happen to be shopping in the mall where they're located.

Been coming to this location for over 10+ years now.  Not as much now, but every time I go back, I am reminded why I used to come here so often. With all the new burger places popping up, I've been trying out all, but I still find myself coming back to Red Robin time after time.  The burger combos are fairly standard now as many places have similar toppings for the burgers, but I can't stay away from the steakhouse fries!  The fries are unlimited and you can ask them to bring you some before your order is even taken.  I think I eat at least 3-4 baskets' worth every time I am there. Sprinkle some of that tasty seasoning and it is straight up addicting! BBQ Whiskey River Burger is probably still my favorite after trying out all the different ones.  I guess I am sucker for the crispy onion straws.  The perfectly buttered toasted bun here is underrated. On the most recent visit, found out they also have petite versions of all their burgers.  Good for the ladies or if you just want to load up on fries haha. This is probably my favorite chain.  I like it so much that I don't even think of it as a chain! Once in awhile I'll order a strawberry lemonade and ask for extra strawberries just to relive the good old days.

I used to love Red Robin but the last 3 times I've come I was very disappointed in the quality of my meal tried the riblets they were overcooked and dry, tried the chili burger and it was the worst, last night I got a burger so dry and burnt around the edges I left it there and each time I've left over half my meal and told the servers it was subpar and they just kinda stared at me. So last night is the last dime red robin gets from me I can get a burger anywhere.

If you've been to Red Robin before then you know what they're about.  Great burgers and bottomless steak cut fries.  I've been to this location twice during lunch with a couple of coworkers.  The first time the service was okay, nothing to complain or cheer about.  Today we were helped by "E.J" and it was fantastic service.  He was really nice and constantly made sure that everything was going good.  No mistakes with the order and never had to ask him for a refill.  He pretty much kept his eyes on the glasses and filled them up when they were at "dangerously" low levels haha.  You can't really go wrong with any of the burgers, and when you add a fried egg on top it is tres magnafic.  Me and the gang will definitely be stopping by for future lunches.  Keep up the good work.  Red Robin....YYYYYUUUUUMMMM!!!!

They treated my son like cramp, the waitress (jasmine) didn't have any customer service skills. It was my sons birthday and they didn't want to sing to him, didn't bring out the bday sundae. Waitress rolled her eyes when my son asked, "why can't u guys sing happy birthday like u always do". She should be fired!!!!

This review is strictly for a take out order. Came in tonight to order for my family.  Star # 1 for the Host Bekah Star # 2 for the large Iced Teas she gave me -Minus 1 for the one, 3 inch piece of bacon on my Mom's California Burger, lame. -Minus 2 for the amount of fries given, especially since it's endless in the restaurant. Just because I'm taking it home doesn't mean I should open all three burger cases and only one had an OK amount...the other 2 orders had 6 fries each. -Minus 3 for the bogus milk shake! I asked if the classic size was a good size and she explained that the Monster size was like having the normal size cup in the restaurant and the extra shake in the tin, so I went with that option. They barely filled the 20 oz. cup that it came in. *Angry pregnant lady face* Not worth $9 and the entire meal was COMPLETELY not worth $50 for 3 people. I feel completely ripped off.
I asked not to sit at the bar.  So, after a 10-15 minute wait I was seated... at the bar!  Root bear is flat....bad start already!

This place is one that I have been going to for about 10 years. It is situated at one of the galleria mall entrances. I have never waited more than 5 minutes to be seated, but than again I usually go as a party of two. It does seem to remain busy and gather a young crowd because of its location.  The service is great. The whole crew works as a team and is very responsive to your needs. Everything is clean.  The food is reasonably priced and tastes really good. They have tons of burgers and most entrees come with bottomless steak fries. They also have salads, wraps, chicken, fish, desserts, malts and a full service bar.This is a great place for a date or even to bring the whole family for a nice lunch or dinner. It gets loud because of the people who frequent there so if you are looking for a romantic date night after the movies... This might not be the place.  If you want decent food, a nice easy meal time and don't mind noise and people, then I recommend you give it a try.

2 golden words: Bottomless Fries. I love them. Especially when I shake a bit extra of Red Robin seasoning. Sure ill probably increase my blood pressure and water retention, but so what! They're so good. Burgers are good. They're a nicely sized. I generally live anything with cheese and bacon. My favorites include the: *Bacon Cheeseburger- classic burger with bacon and cheese *Guacamole Bacon Burger- a step up from the classic with guacamole.  *Royal Red Robin Burger-nice! Bacon, cheese, and wait for it...topped    with a fried egg. Transformed into something a lil special. It's cool that you can substitute turkey for beef. You can also get a wheat bun instead, or no bun at all. Service is okay. If there's a wait, it's usually not too long.

Horrible horrible horrible horrible. So very disappointed in this place. I usually go to the Lakewood red robin which I awesome but this is closer to home so I decided to give it a try FOR MY BIRTHDAY!! I actually love the food at red robin, the service at this location is beyond horrible, at least when I went on Saturday night. I so wish I could actually give this zero stars. I told my husband I wanted to go to red robin to top off my birthday weekend because I had not been since last year. My how this particular one has changed in just a year. The server never refilled our lemonade, was not concerned that the food was taking forever, and didnt seem to care to even bring out our french fries to hold us over. They weren't that busy, we were seated around 8:20 and a 9:30 we still didnt have our food. We left because we were starving and disappointed. All i wanted was my Banzai burger, my one year old wanted the french fries, and my husband wanted the chili cheese burger. What was so hard Red Robin Redondo Beach? This review is a week later and I am still disappointed and disgusted.

Red Robin food sort of is what it is.  This review is for the service we received. Yesterday was my first visit to this Red Robin.  We were seated at a table in the bar area, which was a mistake.  After sitting for a solid 5-10 minutes without anyone acknowledging us or offering to pour a drink, the waitress finally arrives.  I ordered a diet coke - which was completely and utterly flat (some people like this, I do not). I was able to get through two sodas without the food arriving.  At that point, we had already been sitting in the restaurant for more than 30 minutes.  I was starving.  Looking around, I realized that the handful of people seated before us also remained food-less.. this didn't bode well. When the food finally came, my burger was acceptable and what I expected from a Red Robin.  Getting the check was another 20 minute ordeal (even when my companion just shoved his card into the waitress' hand without taking the check to examine it). I don't know what this place's service is usually like, but I would describe my experience as "glacially paced".  Unacceptable.  Perhaps it is different outside the bar?  *IF* I return here for some reason, I will ask not to be seated in that area.

Ok. I was Hungry one night and saw the commercial for the Bottomless steak fries that looked SO SEASONED Crisp and HOT! Stopped by a few days later, of course ordered the steak fries, the Croissant blt sandwich which was pretty good, Although I requested my croissant to be heated, it did NOT come out heated but it still tasted buttery/soft/good. my BF ordered their burger, it was Good, the steak fries came out and looked NOTHING like the commercial..sURPrising? NO. Looks NOTHING like how it did on the commercial!!!!!  The fries came out room temp. WITH NO seasoning and there were literally 8 pieces of it.  we req'd more, which came out fresh.  1st batch came out room temp,while the 2nd batch came out hot. they do have the seasoning on the table so you can add however much you please.  the Limeade drink DID NOT come in those fancy glasses, NOT that It really mattered but she didn't make it that good.  and OF COURSE I asked her for another in a to-go cup.. which TASTED MUCH BETTER. WTH. Guess 2nds are best. HERE.  Service was good. No crowds on a weekday afternoon.
If you're looking for burgers, you gotta try this place out. Also, I love the bottomless fries and the campfire sauce.

Red Robin is our go to place for birthday lunches with a group of work friends.  The service and burgers are consistently good.  My favorite burger that I always go for is the Blu Burger which is topped with a hearty amount of blu cheese, fried onions, lettuce, tomato and dressing.  My burger is always cooked perfectly as I order, slightly pink.  All the burgers come with streak fries.  The fries are sprinkled with seasoning salt and are perfectly crisp and tender.  Gotta love the bottom less fries! If you join the Red Robin club, you get a free burger during your Birthday month!
Every time i come here the service is great and the burgers are incredible. It is a freindly environment and we come here at least once a week. keep up the great work.
haven't been here in years, not a convenient location for me but do enjoy the food.  Had the Whiskey Burger which was very yummy.  Good service so when I find myself back in the area I will stop in.
I went with my husband for lunch and waited for 20 minutes giving them the benefit of the doubt, and still wasn't acknowledged so we walked out.
First time here and it was OK waiter was slow ... And damn why so much mayo on my boundless chicken burger .. Hold the salt on the fries thank you thank you
lots of fun drinks and atmosphere.   then when ur stuffed walk around the mall.

Red Robin is hands down my favorite place to get a burger. I like it better than just about any other burger you can get (and yes, that includes In & Out). I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. . . and I've always had good service. Love their garlic fries as well! Highly recommended!

The food was good, however our waiter seemed overwhelmed by all the customer's ( I went on a Saturday night) . My group of 4  had to ask him for extra fries and drink refills multiple times before he attended us.

I've experienced better service than I got today at red robin. Today the service was really slow and unnecessarily since it was not busy, which is even more irritating.  Sat down, got our drink order. One mixed drink and one coffee. The coffee came first. It was cold. Asked for another cup. Five minutes later, my drink came, and it was watered down and flat. Had to ask for another one of that.  Food came, no napkins or silverware. Had to GET UP and ask for that because most of the servers were congregating near the hostess area and having a good time with each other instead of making rounds and seeing if people needed anything. I couldn't get anyone's attention! No one checked on us, and the only time we were asked if we needed anything else was after we had already gotten everything ourselves practically. Just bad service all around. The servers were more into chatting wtih each other than paying attention to the customer. The food is good here. I've never had anything bad. The food is 4 stars. The service is 1 star.
I would have been happier going to in n out!  Overpriced!  Happy hour, only for draft beer.  The service was terrible!!  Employees complaining.  Don't bother!!

I really enjoyed our late lunch served by Brooke, our waitress..she was an awesome waitress... She was always one step ahead in service like as if she read our mind..Great customer service skill and positive  attitude... Red Robin is lucky to have her..
I get a free birthday burger every year and never use....well this year I did.  The burger was good was not wild about the fries but loved the ice tea.
We've had Jamie (female) twice, as our server. She is very friendly and attentive. We've never had to ask for a refill on drinks or BBQ sauce! Thanks Jamie!

Food was great, especially the blue cheese burger.  The food is a 4+, but. Rated them low because of our server.  The service was lousy.  I plan on giving this particular restaurant another chance--however I will make sure that I don't get the same server.  She was decent at her job.  The problem tho: after taking our order, she took another order for a party next to us that came in quite awhile after us, then went to a 3rd table and chit-chatted with them for over 3 mins.  She hadn't left our area, and therefore hadn't turned in our order.   I eventually interrupted her, and asked that she turn in our order, especially since we were starving. Unfortunately for her, this poor service resulted in her getting a lousy tip.  I'm one to tip 20% and more, but her flirtaceousness (with the other customer) ruined today's experience for me.  I hope she got a good date out of it!
I love the pretzel and cheese dip appetizer....we got 2 while waiting for our food with extra cheese!!!!

My family and I have been to this Red Robin numerous times in the past - its the closest one around and they always have good burgers. We came here for dinner last night and immediately noticed that they changed their menus. They were a lot more organized and seemed to have a few new additions - but our favorites were still there so we ordered them: my mom and I always get the sauteed 'shroom burger and my dad and sister get the guacamole bacon burger. We are definitely creatures of habit - always getting the same thing, but we really love those burgers. However, when we received our burgers and took a bite, we were actually pretty disappointed because they just didn't taste the same. My dad and sister's guacamole bacon burger had a tiny blob of guacamole on it. There was such a small amount of it on there, my dad actually thought they forgot to put guacamole on it in the first place. My mom's and my sauteed 'shroom burger was extremely under seasoned. The mushrooms are usually really buttery and flavorful and this time they just tasted watery - no flavor at all! I had to ask for some horseradish to spread on the burger to get some flavor in there - but it wasn't really what I wanted. The only thing that saved the evening was our waitress. She was really great. She didn't even need to write down our orders, she just memorized them and didn't get a thing wrong. She brought everything out quickly and was very friendly - I wish I caught her name! So overall, this was a mostly disappointing visit. Our favorite burgers just weren't what they used to be. I guess with the changes to the menu, there were also changes with the food, and not a change for the better...
Food is okay. It's not the worst service. If you want a sit down meal an be waited on  at this mall it's one of few choices. A bit pricey for the quality.

Birthday month 2013! Free red robin burger (ANY KIND!) during the month of your birthday for joining their Red Robin Loyalty club!  Red Robin isn't the joint I usually go to for my burger fix and I bet it has been tough to compete with the rise of gourmet burgers in the restaurant scene. Their free birthday burger promo definitely lured me in to give Red Robin a try. RR isn't horribly expensive (avg $10 a burger with side) but their burgers are pretty regular and definitely smaller than expected (I could finish an entire burger on my own). The best part is their bottomless side!! You can get either fries, BROCCOLI or a side salad. They do give a small portion of the side (probably so one doesn't waste) but you can keep ordering them.  Service was pretty average...probably because we sat at the bar area. We felt bad asking for more refill of our bottomless side. Looks like this place is one of those I'll frequent once a year ;)  Parking: Easy (located in the South Bay Galleria)  Additional loyalty club perk: free 10th item (they also offer entrees, salads, etc...) A note about the loyalty club: You can sign up online but they will verify your identity with A PHONE CALL (which I find the most annoying part).
Don't always come here but when I do I have a good experience service is quick which I very much like! And food is delicious and they shakes the bomb!

Chose Red Robbins tonight for dinner and was disappointed as soon as we sat at Liz' station (of 4 tables)...  waited about 10 min. Get waitress to come to our table. Another 10 min to get my Strawberry Lemonade and water and a little longer for my daughter's chocolate shake....  another 10 min or so for our soup... then followed bu our main entree.  Thank goodness the food was good. When we finished, I flagged the manager Ivan and told him our issues.  I guess they were overwhelmed but ir seems like our server was nowhere to be found.   :-(   even after all that, we still tipped but only 15% bec. of the bad service..... Maybe next time???

I've been here for their burgers which are great, but today I came for happy hour which sucks. I needed to find somewhere nearby to kill some time for happy hour looked online and found red Robin. The review said a great drink specials and awesome appetizers starting at three dollars. Well they have one appetizer at three dollars and the rest are 5, 7 and 9 (There are only a handful total) and none of them are very good. I know other food specials for happy hour at all! I'm disappointed when I come here again for happy hour! Still haven't found anything to beat elephant bar!

We had great service but there was a problem with a chicken sandwich that we ordered. I notice that my Son took 1 bite and that was it I asked him what's wrong he said it taste like fish so I tried it and sure enough it taste like fish. The Waitress was very nice and removed it from my bill and the Manager came and also spoke to us they were all really nice but this was our 1st time at Red Robin and I think it will be our last it was pretty gross..........

Came here after watching Thor!  It was a tad bit crowded when I went; had to wait 10-15 min. I love these types of burgers. The patty is thick and meaty. Not the cheap stuff fast food places use. I ordered the burger with Swiss cheese and mushrooms. Overall it was good...BUT, they completely forgot the Swiss cheese. I didn't really bother to say anything because it was still good. I love the unlimited steak fries! That'll be the reason I come back if I do. They give you a choice of several different dips for the fries. I got the campfire sauce. It was pretty good! They said it was the most popular one. It went well with the burger too. The service was just okay. Next time, I'll come with a bigger appetite so I can take better advantage of bottomless fries! (I had only managed two rounds before I got full  -__-)

I haven't been to Red Robin in a MINUTE.  I mean like a good decade or so.  I remembered them for their great burgers and strawberry lemonade. I guess that's what I should have ordered!  Instead I came here with my girlfriend and tried something new; Riblets & Clucks or whatever the eff it's called (riblets and chicken basically).  It was okay.  The portions were SUPER small for the price ($13.99!) and I was disappointed as I could have gotten better food for a better value at Chili's or Islands.  The only reason I'm giving this place any stars is because our waiter was great.  Super attentive and nice and checked on us often.  I gave him a good tip because he deserved it, but I wish my bill had been half the price.  I probably wouldn't come here again. This is not the Red Robin that I remembered.

We recently ate at Red Robin. A very nice surprise. It was delicious. The Blue Cheese Burger was the best we've ever had. Juicy, seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection. Sweet potatoes french fries were crispy and warm.  We shared the BBQ chicken salad that was fresh and plentiful..service was excellent and the food came from the kitchen fairly soon. A nice experience all around. One burger and bottomless french fry along with one salad and no drinks: $24.00. A little pricey. Couldn't afford to come here too often. But a nice place for a treat. Will go back for sure.

Had a gift card, cant complain not the best service, not the worse they do just enough. I had the blue cheese burger real good. And the steak fries are good as well, only thing is the shake took too long to get to the table. Overall ill go again don't expect too much

The food is usually good, but you can't always count on good service.  I like their Ghost Chili ketchup and the Thai chili sauce. Their endless fries make the meal better, especially when you are sharing!  :).

They used to be really good with service and their food, but this visit was a little different. Me and my grandmother have been coming here for the past 15 years and we have never ever been disappointed with this place, until today. When we were first seated a woman by the name of Theresa was our waitress. She was super friendly and I appreciated her positive attitude. Unfortunately I didn't appreciate the service. I'm not saying it's all her because she's a sweet woman and helped me out when I asked her to fix the bill for having lemon or some kind of foreign substance on my cup. I think I'm just more mad at the person who trained her. How could they not teach her to look at a glass before giving it to someone? And I'm also mad at whoever trained her because they didn't train her to wait at least 5 mins after getting my food to ask me how things are doing.  I don't know if I hadn't had a chance to take a bite yet. And thirdly, I felt that after she asked how the food was she felt that the customer service was over because I never seen her until it was time for the check. I had another waitress get me a refill on fries and to fix my drink. Normally this place is pretty good even when it's busy but the service today definitely sucked! The food was the same I was just a disappointed about the fries. They say bottomless, which they are but if they were why is it a pain to get a decent amount the first time around? I kind of felt jipped.

Red robin, yum! I've been to many different red robin locations and for a chain restaurant, it's not too shabby. They are all pretty much standard, a bunch of red and bunch of random frames and trinkets all over the place. The atmosphere is okay, depends on the day and the crowd, but I usually have a good experience at red robin, any that I go to. My GO TO pick is definitely the reds tavern burger, pig out style! Aka bacon and bacon aioli! It's just the right portion size, not too big and not too small; I mean with unlimited steak fries how could you go wrong with it?! Don't forget to ask for honey mustard to dip it in, yum!  Tasty, affordable, chain restaurant, why not.  Happy eats, loves! ^_^

Today, I ordered the Crispy Chicken Burger with fries. I began with clam chowder. Coca-Cola to drink. My mom ordered soup and salad. My mom thought the chowder was a bit watery. Maybe they gave her a different batch, mine was fine.

Came in at around 2 o'clock & I didn't get my food until 244pm. The restaurant wasn't that busy at all so I didn't understand the wait time. When the food finally arrived the fries were lukewarm. The best thing about the meal was the Freckled Lemonade. We had a busy waitress. I guess they were understaffed today.

Closing time 10pm, we strolled in at 9:45 and received not one stink eye. Kudos.  This was my first time at Red Robin. Menu was very typical. Service incredibly friendly and welcoming (even if they may have spit in our food because we showed up at closing time). Fries are bottomless and that's always a plus. Didn't take advantage of drink specials, but they seemed to have some decent ones. Enough to pique my interest and possibly return. I'd like more non-burger options, but that's probably a bit much to ask for a burger joint. The french onion soup was delish, though. Cheesy with a good chunk of bread..and really, it's all about the cheese, ain't it? BF had a bacon cheeseburger which he thoroughly enjoyed. Not too shabs, Not too shabs at all.

Great service, great food. The meat in my burger was great  quality not one complain about it.. Love that there not blasting music like other restaurant's and the amount of attention for there clients is in point. Our server Lizz was great.

In love with their egg burger don't exactly know the name but it's a gourmet one. Bottomless fries topped with thousand island dressing and strawberry lemonade is always on my order list. Burning love is also a great burger to try if you like something with a kick to it. Just don't try their so called loaded fries because it's just regular fries with thousand island dressing and cheddar cheese on top.
Came in for one of their delicious malts and a snack around 2:30 pm. There were a few booths open (7) but none were cleaned off. Had to sit in bar and for that you get 2 stars!
The food is great....The onion rings are delicious and the sauce that comes with it will send you to heaven! !!
Red Robin still holds the same great service I remember when I was a kid. Miss being here. I miss the food and now I get to have a wonderful lunch date with my wonderful boyfriend.

VERY DISAPPOINTED With Customer Service. This review is a little late since the incident happen a month ago, but anyway.  I am Gluten Free (GF) - not by choice, unless I choose to be sick.   This review only applies to the REDONDO BEACH LOCATION - I have never had an issue with the Lake Forest, CA or  Hillsboro, OR (the two I visit most often) or the other locations I have gone to in the past years. I was working on a small project in the South Bay and the producer said I could order food from a place of my choosing since the restaurant they ordered from was not GF Friendly.  I choose Red Robin, I have been to several Red Robins in different cities and states and was always happy with the service I received - especially the fries. So I ordered a basic GF Bun (as listed on the menu) with a standard hamburger.  The hostess taking the order with GF Bun and GF Fries saying there was no issue with fulfillment.  Of course they had a contact number if anything needed to be questioned or revised.    So the very kind, and extremely busy, Producer's Assistant goes to the RED ROBIN GOURMET BURGERS in REDONDO BEACH and finds out there are no Gluten Free buns as originally promised and they do not have any Gluten Free fries.  -  So they could not fulfill the requested order. I completely understand that they run out, but that is the whole point of giving your phone number so they can contact you to let you know of changes - not when you show up and 20-30 minutes when the order is suppose to be ready.   Well the Order was not ready and they were waiting for the customer to revise.  If I had been informed sooner,  I might have changed my order to something easier.  Just like when you order dining in, the waiter or waitress comes by and lets you know within minutes of the order being placed if there is a problem. The Assistant made the best call - since they did not know what items they had in stock she got me a lettuce wrap and a side salad, which granted was healthier but not as enjoyable.  As most GF people know salad tend to be the safest order at most restaurants... but I am kinda sick of Salad as the only option.

Their burgers always hit the spot, but this location's service is often a miss.  On this recent visit, our waitress was already apologizing up front because she knew that the kitchen was running way behind.  The table next to us complained and got 50% off their bill.  Thus our waitress got proactive and let us know that there's a delay, and brought us fries ahead of time.   The table next to us tried to use a gift card, but the store's system was down so they couldn't verify the balance on the card.  Those patrons reluctantly said okay, they won't use the card this time, but that just meant that Red Robin just swindled them into spending a lot more money than intended when those customers just wanted to cash in on their gift card value.

This place is pretty average for service and food, the real reason why I come here is becaues I love there refillable fries. But remember this, every waiter is a gate keeper to more fries and its an up hill battle to get more of them with extra ranch. You will never win, you will always get less fries then you expect and the servers will never give them all up. Truth be told Red Robin hires leprechauns and they like to hoard all there golden fries and parade around them at the end of the night. Great service at this location. Our waitress kept asking how we were doing, loved it. I like how all the locations have drink specials all day. That's pretty major. The GF bun was actually good, had nice texture and was soft. Good job Red Robin. Next time, I will take advantage of their dipping sauces for the fries.

I forgot the email I received where they said I could get half price burger for my half birthday...so I was pleasantly surprised when I went to pay for the burger and it was only 5 bucks!  Join the burger club.

I believe the biggest problem with this location of Red Robin is their seating layout. It was not well thought out. All you have to do is go inside and you will quickly understand what I am saying. But, it is truly a poor business model as I know many people, including myself, who are very reluctant to go here due to this fact.   Then, there are the outdoor tables; where I prefer to sit. These tables are much more separated. The problem is, there is an exterior bench, right on the wall of this restaurant, where people sit and smoke. People also stand right next to the wall and smoke. And, oh yeah, don't believe the commercial about a free burger on your birthday. The commercial doesn't tell you that you have to be signed up with their program to get one. I've had a few friends go here on their birthday expecting to get their eats on for free. But, no-go.

Reeeeed Robin ... yummmmmm. When I was in Hawaii, I would always see the Red Robin commercials on TV and want to go there even more, simply because there are no Red Robins in Hawaii.   But ever since I moved to California, I think I've been to Red Robin enough times to figure out my tried-and-true favorites. Even if I'm not a diehard burger fan, there's plenty on the Red Robin menu to choose from. One of my favorite entrees I ever got from Red Robin was discontinued--a full-sized entrée of creamy Mac & Cheese--but there are still a lot of menu offerings that I do like.   Of course, there will usually some sort of featured burger/promotion when you go to Red Robin, based on the time of year you are visiting or the different current events (sports events, etc.). But here are some of my favorites from the Red Robin menu:   "Crispy Chicken Tender Salad": This is my usual order whenever I go to Red Robin. This salad features a classic lettuce mix tossed with hard-boiled eggs, hardwood-smoked bacon, tomatoes and Cheddar, as well as chunks of Red Robin's classic "Crispy Chicken Tenders." The chicken tenders totally make this salad. There's a good amount of chicken that comes with the salad, and the dish is served with two pieces of garlic focaccia bread (especially amazing when they're warm) and your choice of dressing. While the honey mustard dressing is especially popular, I usually go for the blue cheese. This is probably one of my favorite salad entrees at a restaurant.    "Smoke & Pepper": This gourmet burger is one of the more recent additions to the Red Robin menu and is part of the eatery's recently launched "Finest Gourmet Burgers" line. This creation features a hamburger patty topped with black pepper bacon and extra sharp Cheddar cheese in between slices of a toasted ciabatta bun. The sandwich is served with the eatery's house-made Smoke & Pepper ketchup (which I opted to have on the side). I tried this burger when it first debuted and I was not disappointed with the creation. Basically, with this line of "Finest" burgers, Red Robin is upping the ante and creating more "gourmet" sandwiches. I loved the smoky, peppery flavor of this entrée, and it wasn't too spicy for me to handle. It tasted just fine without the ketchup, and a side of steak fries accompanied the burger, in true Red Robin fashion.   "Bruschetta Chicken": I've only tried this "Bruschetta Chicken" sandwich once, but I absolutely loved the pesto aioli. This dish is complete with grilled chicken breast topped with fresh bruschetta salsa, pesto aioli, Provolone, romaine lettuce and balsamic cream on rustic ciabatta bread. I ordered my sandwich with the salsa on the side, but the other flavors blended together perfectly. The chicken was tender, and the pesto-cheese blend was amazing, with the crunchy ciabatta to top it off.   "Arctic Cod Fish & Chips": I'm always on the hunt for a good fish 'n chips, and Red Robin's version doesn't disappoint. The eatery's version of this dish features premium hand-battered cod fillets that are fried to crispy perfection and served with bottomless steak fries. It's served with dill'd & pickle'd tartar sauce, and you can also use malt vinegar for additional flavor. If I don't feel like eating my usual salad or one of the chicken sandwiches, this entrée is my go-to.   "Mac N' Cheese": Though this is no longer an entrée (much to my dismay), you can still get the "Mac N' Cheese" as a side, and it also accompanies the "Riblets & Mac N' Cheese" entrée. I love this version of mac 'n cheese because it's classic yet incredibly creamy, featuring a cheesy blend of soft noodles.   "Mountain High Mudd Pie": I only had this dessert once, but boy, was it phenomenal. If you're an ice cream lover, then this is for you. The "Mountain High Mudd Pie" features piles of chocolate and vanilla ice cream layered with fudge, caramel and OREO cookies. I always get this dessert sans whipped cream because it has plenty of sweetness on its own. I love the combination of the OREO cookie crust, topped with the luscious ice cream and drizzled with the sticky caramel and fudge.   "Gooey Chocolate Brownie Cake": Though I can't say this "Molten" dessert is better than the one at Chili's, it's still a good sweet option to finish off your meal. This moist, indulgent chocolate brownie cake is topped with vanilla ice cream and hot fudge and is served with sweet strawberries and a berry sauce. The last time I had this brownie cake, there were a bit too many strawberries/too much berry sauce for my liking, as the sauce was a bit tart. But I love the texture of the fudgy brownie cake, and when combined with the vanilla ice cream and hot fudge, it's heaven on earth.

Red robin burgers are decent sized...  I have always asked to have them cut in half, so it would be easier to eat.  So, it was interesting when my waitress argued with me that they won't cut burgers in half anymore, then suggested she bring me a knife and I can cut it myself.  Why? Because it ruins the aesthetic value and won't look pretty anymore.  If this is truly Red robin policy, WTH corporate, seriously? If a customer wants a burger cut in half, cut the burger in half. Not gonna lie. Things started very, very roughly. Came for dinner after a long day, hungry and ready to grub. Took the server a long time to approach the table. 20+ mins. We were initially approached for drinks by the bus-boy. Indicative of good team work, at least. Server finally came. We were ready and ordered our app and meal at once. Appetizer came within an appropriate length of time. Food tho, well...that showed up about a half-hour after we finished our appetizer. And of course, it was cold. Considering we'd both ordered vegan patties....this was ridiculous. When the waitress returned, I voiced my frustration. She immediately offered to make me another but I was starved, I told her not to worry about it. I'd eat the one she served. The vegan patty was bland but no big deal, that's what you get when you order vegan at a burger joint. So there I sat, eating my cold, bland vegan burger - conjuring up a scathing review when she appeared. Stephanie (the waitress) had brought me a freshly made burger. "Even though you said not to, I had them make you a fresh one anyway" she said. "I've also taken care of both your burgers". "I'm sorry for delay in your meals [she inserted an excuse about a computer failure here], I hope you'll at least take this one home with you". It was as if she'd simultaneously given me warm hug and slapped the negative review right out of my head.  I was impressed. And grateful at the effort she'd made. It reminded me that outstanding customer service - even when so much has gone wrong - can always win someone back. Although I won't be back for the amazing vegan burger, I will be back, and RR can thank Stephanie for that. And it also speaks highly of a company where their employees have been trained to make customer satisfaction (within reason) a priority. Thanks Steph.

I really like this place in comparison to other chain restaurants that serve food and alcohol.

This location has gone downhill over the past few years. At one time they removed their spinach and artichoke dip from the menu - then when it returned, it was NOT the same. They also got rid of the "Just In Quesadilla." More recent visits have garnered dry burgers with scant toppings, enough bread in the bun to feed an army for a week, and "blah" french fries. Tonight - well, tonight was the end for me. Our server Liz was top notch. Every table in her section was filled but she made us feel like we were her top priority. She easily answered my questions about certain menu items, did not pressure us to order too quickly, and was generally attentive. Appetizer came, one of the three appetizer plates was very dirty, with visible dried food stuck on it. Ditto for one of the glasses of water. Ew. Easily rectified though. There were three of us in my party. My two companions ordered the clucks & fries, and the clucks & shrimp. Both of those meals were just ok - dry chicken and a lettuce leaf garnish that was so huge and wet it had to be removed immediately to prevent soggy french fries.  I ordered the macaroni and cheese as a side dish, and it was actually very good. I also ordered the boneless Whiskey River chicken wings, which are on a separate menu and I think are a limited time item. These are served with the onion strings and home made potato chips. The first piece I tried seemed to be mostly fat, so I did not think much of it and set it aside. The second piece was fairly large, so I attempted to cut it apart with my fork. I was about to give up and ask for a knife when I noticed WHY it would not cut - IT WAS RAW. Not just a little, and not just a small portion - RAW ALL THE WAY THROUGH, as in NOT COOKED and PINK. It just so happened that Liz and another lady who I presume was possibly the manager arrived at the same time to ask if everything was ok, and I passed my plate over and discreetly let them know what the problem was. They were both very kind and apologetic, and said they would speak with the kitchen staff. Several times they offered to re-do it or replace the item but I declined. I only requested they remove the boneless wings from my bill; the end result was a much larger discount and adjustment. For that, I have to say the customer service was excellent.  Unfortunately, the negative experience with dirty dishes and undercooked food will prevent me from returning for a very long time, if ever.

This is by far the only location where it takes 40-50 mins to receive an order of three "burgers." I've been here twice, and both times, the wait is ridiculously long and the waiters are incompetent. If this restaurant was cooking steaks or 5 star Italian with a crowded area, I'd understand. But, it's burgers and fries. It doesn't take almost an hour to deliver the most basic American dish. And on top of this, people who came in after us received their food 20 mins before ours. This occurred TWICE. The waiter, Mauricio, wrote my order wrong and then blamed me for the mistake. I told him, specifically, what I wanted while pointing to the item on the menu. He also forgot an onion soup that we explicitly ordered and never returned our refills. BUT he blamed me/us? This waiter is clearly forgetful and needs to work elsewhere.   I asked the manager, "Why does it take so long?" She attempted to explain using the current occupancy, which couldn't have caused 50 mins of waiting with so many empty seats available, and concluded that a chicken sandwich took longer to make. But, after I told the waiter to correct my order at the kitchen, it took less than 4 mins, not 40 mins. Then she spoke to us like we made the mistakes, yet our water, two lemonades, and onion soup still hadn't came. We requested those items 10 minutes beforehand.   This place is ridiculous. I'll never return.

If you've been to one Red Robin, you've been to them all. Solid burgers, freckled lemonade and BOTTOMLESS FRIES! What more could a fat girl want?  For a burger chain, I like Red Robin. Prices are decent and food is consistently good. Also I mean who can say no to bottomless steak fries? Not me. Last time I came I had their Tavern Double Cheeseburger and...it was better than the one I had in Vegas at that super fancy place owned by a very big name celebrity chef. So, yeah.  The Royal Red Robin is also a good choice, used to be my go-to, if you're in the mood for a messy burger with an egg on top. This location though I must say is probably my least favorite just because I don't really care for the layout of this restaurant. The flow is very strange since the entrace is right in the middle of the whole place. Also, it's attached to the mall so it can get pretty packed which in turn, typically causes this one to have very slow service. I've only been to a few other ones but they always have better service and seem a lot more put together. That's kind of how chains are though, you never really know what you're going to get!

I will never again go to a Red Robin restaurant again. 3 days ago, I had no opinion about Red Robin. I had been there probably twice before in my life. This review reflects my experience from 2 nights ago.  I've never in my life visited a restaurant with as poor customer service relations as this place. Neither managers appeared to care about customer satisfaction, even when they were clearly in the wrong. This goes for both the personnel and corporate relations.  So what is it that was so horrible. Let me start of first by saying that I would not have chosen to come here if it was not for the Free Birthday Burger voucher that was sent to me unsolicited by Red Robin. So, I grabbed my roommate and came down to have some drinks and a burger. When we first got there we were handed menus which were stuck together with the stickiest of syrup all over them. Do they not have the decency to at least clean off their menus? It was very disgusting. Little did I realize that the attitudes of the manager and servers would be equally disgusting. After ordering drinks, I handed the bartender my voucher and expected it to be honored as it was legitimate and was nothing fraudulent on my part. It even had my name on it. The bartender returned and said that they would need my club/membership card or something to that effect. I had absolutely no idea what they were talking about. The Free Burger Voucher had nothing written on it at all regarding some club membership. In fact, written on the voucher, it said to just "hand it to your server and enjoy a free burger! " So I asked the bartender to bring over the manager. He was of no help and reiterated the same "requirement" that was not mentioned in the voucher. At this point, I'm feeling bamboozled.  I think this is called Bait and Switch. I asked them, why would I receive this voucher from your corporate PR/marketing department if they did not intend to honor it. I even showed the manager the email it came in on my phone to show that it was legitimate. I basically got the sorry your loss attitude as if I were some freeloader who can't afford to buy myself a burger. Now I know managers have the discretion to make customers happy, especially in situations of no fault by the customer. Not here. I was basically told they won't honor it, and my business is of no concern to them. They weren't interested in the business that would have been generated from the rounds of drinks we intended on consuming in celebration of my birthday, but also my roommate would have purchased a dinner. Instead, they preferred to leave me with a sour taste in my mouth, and stickiness all over my hands from their dirty menu. Instead, the manager preferred to leave me with the worst possible impression on their establishment that could be possible. Like I said, I went from having no opinion of Round Robin before going there, to now having the worst possible opinion of their establishment and their personnel. I will never again go to Red Robin, which means my friends and family that go out with me will never go there also.  For Red Robin Corporate/Marketing department, I would suggest that you not send out Birthday Vouchers that you don't intend on honoring. Lucky for us there was an Island's right around the corner that had an excellent late night happy hour. The food was great and the service there was excellent. Although we wasted half an hour at Red Robin just to get the Round Robin treatment, Island's came to the rescue for the night. We were happy to spend our $$ there!

I really like this place. It's located at the front of the mall next to the entrance by Starbucks, to the left of Nordstroms. They seemed to have redesigned the interior since my last visit about a year ago so it's bright, modern, and new looking.  The bar area's pretty nice and welcome, which is where I sat.  It seats about 6, I got there around 8pm and nobody was there.  There's also 4 tables behind, the rest of the dining area is built for tables of 4 or more + patio seating outside. They now have an ok happy hour with $3, $5, $7, $9 appetizers and alcohol around the $5 range (beer, wine, cocktails) which runs from around 6-closing I think.  The bartender told me that they were still running HH specials at least when I was there until closing.  I can see this being very popular after a night of shopping and hunger.  Looking at the new menu selections, they have some interesting burger combinations, some that looked like fancy creations out of steakhouses.  There was the Banzai (Hawaiian), the Bleu Ribbon, the Royal Red Ribbon (with an egg on top) to name a few plus about 10 others.  I ended up getting the Prime Chophouse with endless steakhouse french fries as the side, which you also get your choice of.  The burger was very meaty and juicy, plenty of mushrooms and the fried onions were great! It was very filling, I didn't have room for dessert or even for a refill of the fries.  The burger was good, there's also a new crab cake burger they were featuring which I'd love to try next time.  Ok service (I waited about 10 minutes after paying waiting for my change, so-so attention but I was sitting by myself at the bar so maybe she thought I'd get her attention if I needed it) Superpro hint: Get a free Customer Card and sign up for it, on your birthday they give you a free burger and also you get points everytime you spend.

I love this place!  My kids love it, bottomless fries, shakes, burgers and sandwiches are great. Janette is always so welcoming and nice! Appetizers are great. The servers always inform you about whats new on menu and make sure to leave anything out when asking about an entree. Alfredo was extremely tentative to our comfort. Red Robin is my favorite chain restaurant, narrowly beating out Outback Steakhouse. The burgers are huge, juicy and savory. The special seasoning at the tables is so amazing that I frequently remove the cap and just inhale deeply. The thick-cut steak fries are delicious and, of course, come with unlimited free refills. They even bring out orders of fries for the table before the meal comes, like Mexican restaurants do for chips. The root beer floats are sweet and fizzy and, like the fries, are bottomless. Word of advice: come here with an appetite. They never stop bringing you seconds and you need two or three refills of everything to really appreciate the experience. For dessert, I recommend the Towering Doh! Rings...miniature croissant/doughnuts all stacked on a giant wooden peg. Soft, sugary, and served fresh from the oven, it's pretty hard to stop eating them. A typical meal for two can run $30-40, a great value for the portions and quality. Everything I've said above could apply to the entire chain, but this location at the South Bay Galleria is great unto itself. There's nothing I enjoy more than coming here after watching a movie at the AMC on the other side of the mall. It's nice and clean, frequently crowded but never too loud. The waitstaff are friendly and helpful, and do everything they can to keep you eating, like the stereotypical grandmother always commenting that her grandchildren are skin and bones. To sum up: the chain has great food in great quantities at great prices, and this particular one has a great location with great service. Yummm. Been here three times so far, and can't wait to go again.

This is becoming our go-to, family restaurant.  Our approximately four visits here have all been great.  It's tends to be crowded, which is a good sign, but the wait can be a bit long.  Once they seat you, the service is excellent, and the food very good.  We love the southwestern chicken salad, and the burgers are great as well.  Very kid-friendly restaurant, and I like that they have sports on TV while you're waiting to be served.

This is my first review and I've always had a decent dining experience when coming here, but I am completely grossed out right now. I came here today for a quick lunch. I ordered an appetizer, which was good, and a garden burger with mac n cheese as my side. My burger came out with fries instead of the mac n cheese. I had to put my order in again for my correct side. Waited for a few minutes, no problem. When I got my mac n cheese, I noticed that something black was sticking out on the side of the dish underneath the cheese. I thought somehow a topping of some sort was accidentally mixed in, but when I inspected it, I noticed that it wasn't a topping. It looked like a fairly large piece of glass or sharp object. I alerted my waitress and she calmly took it to the back. After 10-15 minutes, the manager came to my table and said that it looked like an acrylic nail. She proceeded to tell me that she asked all of her staff about it, but no one's nails matched the one that was found in my food. She then told me that none of the cooks or servers are allowed to wear fake nails or long natural nails. So....where did it come from? Hopefully management gets down to the bottom of this because it's unacceptable. I won't be eating here again anytime soon.

My very first time ever stepping in to this place.  I don't come to this mall very often, but I am aware it has been her.  My wife and I took our kids and met her sister and her kids for a late dinner.  Checked in about 745ish and was told it would be about 30 min for a table(there was an entire section on the inside part of the mall that had 4 or 5 empty tables).  About 825 we were seated(I was changing a diaper) and everyone was asked what they wanted to drink.  From what I was told, water was not offered(I know in some places you need to ask for water now, so I am not holding it against anyone).  I made it back and was told everyone ordered drinks, I added coffee to it.  About 10 minutes later my wife and her sister got there drinks and I got my coffee, and none of the kids drinks were delivered.  From there we ordered our food.  I actually gave our waitress the ultimate decision of placing my order(gave her 3 options and let her pick) Just before the food arrived about 20 min later, two of the kids drinks arrived(milk and chocolate milk), After the food was put down we asked about another drink that was missing along with utensils and napkins(we had none).  I also asked about a side that was ordered with my sons meal and she went to get it. When she came back she did not bring the utensils(burgers are easy but mac n cheese is a little tricky) and did not mention the missing drink.  She came back about 5 min later with forks and one napkin for each person, and we were told there were no clean knives(at this moment, I am thinking to my self, "what the serious Fuck?"  How do you have a restaurant and not enough silverware for your guests?) and still no drink.  I took a bite of my burger, but then took the baby to let my wife eat.  Finished my cup of coffee.  I was asked in a pass by attempt if I wanted more coffee, which i definitely needed....  several minutes go by and I got up to walk around with the little fluffball.  I noticed that she wound up bringing a cup over.  When I made it back to the table, no creamer(wa wa waaaaaaaaa)  I was walking around still and asked our waitress if she could bring some creamer over...after a few more minutes of walking, I got to eat, the meal was the teriyaki chicken sandwich and it was very tasty, the SMALL cup of fries were tasty.  She walked by our table a few more times.  I was done with my food, my black coffee was still sitting there and about 10 minutes later she brought the creamer, and the check...(In my time walking around I saw a few people that were seated after us, and they got knives....)   I paid and I left...I honestly did not leave a big tip, $75 bill, and I left $10(I felt that was generous for poor service in my opinion) From what I heard, the food was good all around, but that bottomless fry idea did not exists at our table, not one was asked if they wanted more.  Once again, first time here, maybe I am supposed to ask, but if I didn't have to ask for more coffee, I figured I wouldn't have to ask for more fries... From there, we went outside to hang out for a bit and let the kids play and after about 20 minutes I looked in at where we were sitting, still a mess.... Overall, yes the food was tasty, but waiting, service, and vibe play a big part for me.  I am always willing to give a second try to a place, but a little effort will go a long way....(I am sitting here at 1145 pm drinking my second cup of coffee now....)

Last time we're going to Red Robin.

Fries and dipping sauces are good; if only you got a bit more than 7 fries per refill it might make the wait staff's life easier. Try the southwestern dipping sauce; goes great with fries and onion rings..apparently there are around 30 different types of dipping sauce. Price is about $15 a person before tip

I love red robin, just not this one! Every time I go it seems like there is not nearly enough employees for how busy they are. The employees always seem frantic and not able to give customers proper attention.  On our last visit, we had a very sweet waitress but she was very busy and did not check on us very often. Even though this is a convenient location right in the mall, I do not think we will be returning to this location. Every time we come here the customer service is lacking. I enjoy Red Robin's food every time I go. I love that they have bottomless fries and a pretty full bar. The service at this location can be a bit shaken though. Sometimes you get the feeling that they've forgotten about you. I'm not gonna hold it against them to bad because I'm sure being a server is hard enough without me giving them a a hard time. This location is in the South Bay Galleria so you can eat and shop, or shop and eat.
Been coming here for years, food is always great, staff is amazing. Jannete rocks! Never been let down!

I've gave this place a few shots. I was beyond elated to know that they had gluten free bread and fries! Makes me not have to drive all the way to Santa Monica for a gf burger. It is ok food, good hamburger. My sandwich is plain. Just be here with family. Ok service.

I only came here for the salt seasoning, fries and bottomless drinks. Everything was mediocre.

I haven't had red robin in months due to bad service however I had to give it another chance due to the great tasty burgers and fries. The manager made sure we were being taken care of and our server Christina was very very amazing and informative and friendly. Definitely glad I gave it another opportunity.

The quality of the burgers were good, but not a whole lot better than some of the fast food burgers like Burger King, McDonald's but may be more on par with the cooked when ordered counter service places like In N Out, The Habit, Fatburger and 5 Guys. The average meal or entree is about $10 and if you get a drink, add in tax and tip and you're at around $20 per person.  If you go a bit deeper with appetizers and/or fancier desert drinks, you'll land around $25 per person. I think the prices could go down a notch.  It's less about the portions in terms of their bottomless french fries (or the healither fresh fruit option) and the burger itself, but the patties should be a bit thicker (I'm not sure if the patties are made by a pressing machine or previously frozen but they're reminiscent of Burger King, which isn't bad, but here there's a gourmet price tag 3x+ higher than their fast food peer), and also enable customers to have them cooked to order (i.e., medium rare as opposed to medium well, their default) to get a truly fresh tasting juicy hamburger, so maybe the quality can be taken up a notch.  I'd say the unique ingredients and different named burgers is nice, but the foundation of the hamburger, the beef patty needs maybe a little more TLC in their approach to the perfect burger. I've been going to Red Robin  once in a while since the 1990's, and did notice the re-branding of the restaurant as "Gourmet Burgers" and I know it's been 25+ years with inflation and overhead (employee minimum wage increases too), so can't expect them to be too low, but I think maybe making the burger a bit more remarkable for the price is the solution.   Or have some sort of pre-priced menu with a meal for 2 for $15 (Any 2 burgers w/ bottomless fries) total w/ a soft drink could be a good marketing strategy. I think I felt maybe I could get more or from my perspective better value (be it quality or quantity) for my money, or paid less elsewhere for the same. The service here was fast and friendly as well as attentive. Parking was easy in the South Bay Galleria shopping center mall.  This is in the wing near what now used to be Nordstroms on the Hawthorne Blvd/Artesia (Redondo Beach Blvd) side/corner.
