I suggest you to go to California Pizza Kitchen across from them.  We went there and we got seated right away, with warm bread and olive oil with herbs ready for us to eat.
I come the this place every year to get my birthday burger, and I the service is wonderful. The hostess is always knowledgeable and polite I'm already a regular yearly visitor, keep up the good work.

I decided to go into Red Robin's (for the 1st time ever) while I was waiting to pick up my eyeglasses. I chose to sit at the bar top because I thought service would be quicker. Not only was service below par, the bar area was not busy, and my bartender (Maria) seemed like she was overwhelmed or annoyed (or maybe both). As soon as I took a seat at the bar top she didn't say anything until she completed whatever she was doing. Then she asked me if I wanted drinks without handing me a drink menu or even a food menu. So at that point I had to ask her for a food menu, she handed it off to me but it was clear that she really didn't want to be bothered. I was looking at her screen and it wasn't full, and the other patrons at the bar top seemed content, so I don't know why she had that attitude. When I was finally ready to order, I had a request for the pacing of my food, I wanted my salad out first and the entree out after, she smirked and repeated my order. The food came out just like I wanted however, the chicken wings were so tiny and not even spicy. That was a disappointment, secondly she didn't ask me how I liked my food during the course of my time spent there. I'm giving one star because I can't give negative stars. Service at the bar top was poor and the food was subpar. What makes this horrible is the fact that it was my first time ever dining at Red Robin's and my experience was unpleasant, it wasn't a welcoming environment. I will definitely NOT be returning to Red Robin's. If you choose to eat at Red Robin's go at your own risk and set very low expectations, matter-of-fact don't have any expectations.  And if the bartender Maria, reads this (& I hope she does) you should really learn how to be sociable and personable if you're going to be bartending.
the worst service ever the server  got attitude  cause we ask for  our food to be made over

I came in this past Saturday, wait for 2 people was about 15 minutes...Once we got seated our waitress was really nice, but the wait to get out food was too too long...i ordered the mushroom burger, meat was good but the mushrooms tasted too much like garlic...this was my first time here, and probably my last, its too much of a wait i rather go upstairs to Johnnie Rockets..
Omg I love buffalo style Cajun clucks and fries with ranch. So bad for you. But sooooo good!!!!!!!!!!!!burgers are so good!!!!!!!!! I love the environment. Milkshakes are yummy.

SORRY EXCUSE FOR A BURGER-  Celebrating my birthday a day early .... Good thing I didn't have this on the day of because it would have ruined my birthday. After we were seated it took 15 minutes for a server to come to our table and only because I made eye contact with him. I ordered the Light Lemonade and it tasted watered down like hell. Tasted almost like a normal glass of iced water and even the refills after that tasted the same. I ordered the Buzz Mac N Cheese Double burger .... I should've gone to Johnny Rockets instead because it tasted horrible. A sorry excuse. That's what Red Robin should rename their 'Buzz Mac N Cheese Tavern' burger. It was terrible. Flat, No taste, Mac N Cheese BARELY had any cheese and the 2 patties were really thin with no taste and it was half the size as shown in the menu picture.... The frozen White Castle burgers from Target have more taste than this disgrace... A sorry excuse for a hamburger. The only taste I got out of it was the melted white sandwich cheese it had. I was close to going to California Pizza Kitchen which is across from it but I wanted a burger instead... BIG MISTAKE! I don't know if this burger is the same at any other locations because this is the first time I ordered but atleast at this location on this date October 16, 2016.... It tasted HORRIBLE and everyone working there especially the cooks should be ashamed!

If this was the Red Robin from 5 years ago, this would be five stars. Watching this Red Robin going from my favorite to let's not eat here is pretty sad. I ordered baked mac and cheese, and it took them 3 tries to get it right. First one was frozen still. Second one was frozen in the middle. Third one was burnt. At least, the burger was somewhat decent. The garlic  fries were greasy. The regular fries were dry and had an unpleasant after taste. I paid and went to Denny's to have an actual meal.
Patrice was excellent! She was on top of everything and made everything easy showing how how to use the tablet for games and adding appetizers.
Fantastic experience this time. New management really turned it around.  The whisky river BBQ is worth the effort. Come on out.

I have been here several times now, and now I feel like posting a review.  Today's server was Raul, and he was very courteous and attentive.  He even fixed the reward points for me after I forgot to mention and he printed out the receipt.  I hope he will be the server again next time I visit this location.  If you get him as your server, he will not disappoint you!

My hat goes off to Maria the young lady working the bar :) what a doll and what GREAT SERVICE  I had the night off from school and decided to use my Birthday Coupon soooo.... glad I did. Maria recommend the mushroom burger with a cold Blue Moon RIGHT ON delicious.  Keep up the GREAT SERVICE @ Red Robin
Outstanding service form everyone that works here at Red Robin. You treated us to a special lunch, thank you for showing that you care about us Veterans.  Thank you HM2 Williams
Was just here with my dad. Great service all around from the hostess to or server Angie, kept making sure we were good with what we ordered as well as we got our food quick. Definitely coming back

I was disappointed with Red Robin tonight.  Although the food was consistently great, the service leaves much to be desired. From the moment we were seated, my wife and I knew it might not be a great. They automatically seat is in the bar area. Presumptuous.  We need to sit in the lower seats.  They moved us.  Instead of the server coming by right away, it took the server 5 minutes to come by. She was nice but... We ordered our beverages another seven minutes. By the way no silverware.   Drinks come, still no silverware. (HUGE PET PEEVE).  We waited for about 20 min. I ordered an onion roll for my burger. Never got it.  The manager came by. We said everything is slow. We got fries, still no silverware.   Food comes  same time the fries came.   Waited 24 min plus for our check.  Waitress took an order before we got the check.  Slow night.  Terrible service.

Food was still good.  Service was weak.  I can't name the server because she did not have a name tag on and did not introduce herself.  She did not refill the drink and she messed up the order; although I might not have been entirely clear. But the major problem was when it was time to pay and leave.  I mentioned having a loyalty card and she pulled up that screen on the device on the table that's used to pay the bill and then she left.  It wouldn't accept my phone number.  It wouldn't read the loyalty card when I swiped it.  So I hit the "call server" button hoping to get credit on the loyalty card.  After waiting 15 minutes with no one stopping at the table, I had to pay and leave.  I had to be somewhere. I filed that loyalty card in the trash just prior to writing this review.  No longer needed.

What can I say! It was just OK. Had never been here and probably won't go back. Didn't get a burger but a chicken sandwich and tortilla soup. Both were "OK". Service was OK, atmosphere was OK, and the menu selections were OK. When you're in an OK mood, this is the place to come. Not too much to complain about. OK?

Never have i ever tried red robin before until last night at the mall. Me and my friend came to this location because she wanted to take some santa pictures with her daughter. so sure why not right. we couldnt take the pictures until 7pm, and we got there at 530pm so we had to kill an hour, so we came here to eat because i been craving one of their burgers i keep seeing and my friend said it was the burgers were bomb here. so we got seated and had to run back to the truck to get a bottle of water for her daughter. so i left, i texted her to order me a plain iced tea when the server comes. i returned and no one served us yet. which isnt a big deal because i didn't park that far from them. NOW, heres the thing that i found questionable...the server comes and begins taking orders, but for the family of 7 right across from us! and mind you that me and my friend were there 15min before the family and they got served before we did. then he turned and took our orders, brushed it off like whatever since he finally took our orders. I wanted THE GHOST JALAPENO BURGER, which has 2 patties and obviously JALAPENOS. we let time slide by a bit until the drinks came. So the food came and i didnt notice it at first because me and my friend were just chit-chatting & laughing, so i look at the burger, and guess what...WRONG DAMN BURGER! it was just a PLAIN, BACON CHESSEBURGER with garlic fries(which he did get right) i had gone to the gym earlier before we left to the mall and i hadnt eaten since the morning and we were on a timed schedule, i ate the burger and it was unsatisfying to eat. Didnt want to send it back and wait longer to get the burger i wanted and miss the santa pictures for her. And strangely the manager came out of NOWHERE and gave us a FREE grilled cheese with fries, i looked over at my friend and we both had a confused look on our faces like wtf just happened?! BUT, apparently, strangely enough that the family of 7 got their ENTIRE order on point! there were no complaints, nothing missing, NOTHING!!! NEVER...EVER...AGAIN...will we return to this red robin. Id rather go to carls jr or some other burger joint where they get the food right! Except Mcdonalds, they be fuckin' up wayy too much!

Here's the thing I've noticed over the past couple of years.  There's a female manager who is great.  You can tell she likes her job and sees to it that every paying guest has a good experience.  She's short and sturdy and when she's not there that's when people get slow or lazy service.  Just a heads up. Been coming here since day one and have witnessed this location's many transformations.  I once witnessed a server argue with the guests but this was years ago.  Anyway, when I arrived on Saturday the manager was there but she didn't stay.  So here we go... It wasn't terribly crowded but more servers wouldn't have hurt on a Saturday afternoon in December.  They seat me at the bar and I was tempted to use the machine but it doesn't list everything.  The young male server takes my order and while my weak cocktail took only 5 minutes, a side salad and fries took forever. After waiting more than 20 minutes, it was the wrong salad and I wasn't offered bottomless fries while I waited for a replacement.  The new salad was an entree but I ate it anyway.  A different female manager came around during my wait and I told her service was so-so and she replied "That's nice".  Maybe English isn't her first language. No one apologized for the mix-up nor was a refill offered.  The server presented the check and after 10 minutes, I used the self-pay.  That's when he came around TWICE to wish me a happy holiday.  Had he done that a half hour prior, he would've received a better tip.
Janettee was very kind, funny and patient. The food was good too. I would go back because of her!

We took our little nieces to lunch here and the place is definitely a winner with them. Grill cheese and limitless fries, and can't beat that! The kids also loved having balloons. I had the burger without bread, and it was OK. Hubby had a BBQ burger. I love the sweet potato fries. Service is really remarkably excellent for such a busy place. This is the second time we had Devrianna as our server and she is so courteous and efficient, she is a credit to the place!

This was my first time at a Red Robin establishment since I was a kid.  This location is situated at the entrance of the Galleria Mall off of Hawthorne Blvd.  This is not my favorite mall but with 2 hungry kids in tow, we had to stop quick!   We arrived around 7 pm on a Sunday evening, and the wait for a table was about 15 minutes, which was not bad at all.  Part of the restaurant had this overwhelming smell of ketchup, but luckily we were not seated in this area or I don't think I would have been able to last long.    Our server greeted us right away, was very peppy and did a nice job.  The table next to us was extremely demanding yet she remained patient and kind to them the entire time- I might have lost my cool if I was her but she didn't.  Luckily we were low maintenance and ordered a couple hamburgers and 2 kids meals.  The food was good, not amazing, but it was what you would expect for a decent hamburger and fries.  My burger meat was a tiny bit burnt though, but tasted fine once I cut that part off.    The prices are reasonable and it's a good place for young kids as there are a ton of other kids around too.   I am not sure I would return anytime soon, as I would rather go to CPK across the way, but my husband did enjoy his hamburger more than I enjoyed mine and said he would go back with the kids.

They have good food; however, somehow the past few times I've come here it seems as though they have all these empty seats and not enough servers. So they cram everyone onto one side of the restaurant and somehow still manage to not provide you with great service. It's a constant state of asking for refills on drinks and having some other family in your personal space and basically in your conversation. The food is great, but not worth the price you pay to be treated like that.
I came here with high expectations. They were thoroughly crushed when i found out that they dont even use real robin meat.  I can get a cow burger anywhere...  unlimited fries helped.

The Service: Slow.... not too attentive, server is taking care too many tables.  The Food: Love the kids menu. Many varieties to choose from. Love the bottomless side dish and drinks!! They have free balloons in the lobby and on the kids menu there are games they can play while they are waiting for their food.  Now they have ipad type of the screen on each table so you can order from there. There are also games too. Each game cost $1.99 and you don't need to swipe the credit card to play, they charge you on the bill. So watch your kids when they touch the ipad because you don't want any surprise charges on your bill.  The Parking: Mall Parking lot.... super super super challenging to find a spot!!

Red Robin Burger is always good! They never disappoint me with food. Service was always good and I love dining here since I have been coming here since College.  The server always had big smile when we ask for few things including sauce. Today,  we ordered beer, drinks, 2 burgers and appetizer.  Big order for 2 people.  We asked our server for chipotle sauce for dipping our appetizers, and server had stern face and said "we charge .75 cents for sauce." Wow!! Sorry for ordering appetizer.  I can afford .75 cents, it's just that I didn't understand why they charge you for sauce when we didn't want to eat the ranch dressing that comes with our appetizers. Don't get plain buffalo wings that needs sauce. They charge you for sauce when you ask for different sauce. There are lots of eatery out there and I regret choosing Red Robin today.  They lost 5 star reviews for .75 cents sauce.  If it was worth for Red Robin,  FINE!!!

Whenever my sister and I take our dogs to the groomers, we always stop by Red Robin for lunch and then shopping. The quality isn't as good as I remember, or maybe its just this location or... maybe I just chose the wrong burger but today's visit left me thinking that I shouldn't go to Red Robin anymore. My sister and I arrived at noon and were promptly seated by the host on their "patio" which is actually in the mall. Our server, Shannell was great. Super attentive, quick to ask us if we wanted fries and drink refills and was very friendly. Even though she got a bunch of tables back to back (and 2 large parties too), she still managed to give us great service.  I always get the freckled lemonade ($4.99), free refills! It wasn't very sour today and seemed a bit watered down IMO. My sister thought it was ok though.  - Bleu ribbon burger: tomatoes, lettuce, patty and blue cheese with a chipotle sauce I believe. I love blue cheese so I thought it would be a good choice but I was a bit disappointed when it came out. The buns weren't your traditional bun, and I think I was distracted by the blue cheese because I didn't notice that on the menu, it said onion bun! My burger was cold and the bun wasn't toasted. It wasn't very appetizing. I'm not sure if it was left to sit out while waiting for the fresh batch of fries to come out. My fries were also decent. I thought they could have stayed in the fryer for a tad bit longer.  - Fish and chips $13.49. 4 medium pieces of battered fish on top of a lettuce garnish and served with some tartar sauce and lemon. It came with bottomeless fries but my sister opted out for mac n cheese for $1.49 more. She really enjoyed the mac n cheese and thought the fish was just ok. Not the best she's had according to her.  Our server eventually got super busy, but I think a manager came by our table to ask us if we needed anything else. We requested a box. The cool thing is that you can pay at your table using the ipads they have on the table. Its similar to outback, applebees and other restaurants now a days. Make sure to complete a survey if you were satisfied with your experience! It would help the server a lot!

Me and my husband use to love this place, not soo much this time. We ordered through door dash and they gave him the wrong wrap and the chicken was terrible in the wrap. Our food was thrown together and they had left out extras we had requested.

Been coming to this place for the last two years. Have always sat at the bar and now I know why. Today Sunday we came to get ours fix on and sat to the far left away from the bar. Chantel was our server. I would of been better serving myself. No customer service. No smile. Blunt, poor attitude paying with the ziosk didn't allow us to enter in our rewards number so we tell her we want to pay through her. Comes back and starts saying oh your number went through fine. As if we are dumb and can't enter it in correctly. Maybe if the machine worked like it was supposed to we could of done everything automated. Even order our food and have a robot serve it  I'm pretty sickened and disgusted with the experience.  This experience here. Easily allows me to choose a better place to eat. I bet chucky cheese has better service.  Management don't try to contact me with your petty concern.  I'll eat somewhere else.
This is a great place for quality burgers and bottomless Fries... I have been visiting this place for years now and I highly recommend it.

I came in on a Friday evening with a large party. I was told that it would only be a 30 minute wait. We proceeded to wait for 50 minutes. As we watched others that came in after us go and get seated we began to wonder what could be holding them up. We asked Cynthia how much longer the wait would be and we were told to leave them alone. Cynthia then proceeded to call us liars by saying we weren't told a 30 minute wait. This is the behavior of someone that is too inept to be in the service industry. We took our business elsewhere.

Came here today with gf for birthday.  Usually like the burgers, ordered the billion dollar burger.  CAME OUT RARE. Is that even legal to serve a hamburger like that? Sent back,  gf is already done with her meal.  Happy Birthday.

Great burgers and bottomless fries! I always pass by this place when going to shop. Decided to give it a go. There's mini touch screens at every table and it includes games for your kids which has a small fee as well as being able to pay right there with card. There is a waiting queue but we only waited 5 min to be seated during the rush which made me quite pleased. I never went to red robins in my whole life but here we go~ A m b i a n c e: I love the classic interior of the place. Walls decorated with classic 20th century portraits and pictures. This place is great for a group because its pretty spacious. There is a bar as well with TV playing the usual sports channel. S e r v i c e: We were served by 3 different waiters and I can see the difference between them. The lady taking our order looked like she didn't want to come to work. Not very welcoming but just taking our order fast and not saying much else. Next guy came along and he hurriedly delivered my baja nachos and sped off without saying a word. The last guy was very attentive. Refilled our waters, and even checked up on us to see how we were doing. I guess its like Russian roulette. F o o d: My chicken burger came in undone, like the bun and veggies were all taken out and laid all on the plate. I guess this is how they do it? Not sure but I had fun putting together the burger. Baja nachos were okay, and I also love their unlimited fries. Cripsy and delish. Burgers was pretty good 7.5/10 P r i c e: Its a bit pricey. Most likely be spending above 10 dollars for their burgers. (I can buy multiple in-n out with that money)

Yelp 2017 100 Challenge: 2017 Review 78/100 As an avid patron of Red Robins in the east coast, I am always a frequent customer of Red Robins. It was my first time at this location due to nearby work, and surprisingly, this location was the best that I had been to in Los Angeles. I usually only go to the one at Glendale Galleria, but this location served my burger quickly and fresh with great service! It was one of the first times I've felt that the burger melted in my mouth because it was served so quickly after being cooked. The service was great and I just wish I lived nearby so I could visit this location more often.  Note: Parking is free and abundant as it is part of the mall.

Always loved this place and went back again . It's been a few years and the place is still great !!! Not sure why it got 3 star rating I didn't read the reviews but the food - burgers and fries are the best !!!!               5 star for sure !!! Service was good nothing at of the ordinary but definitely no complaints. I definitely recommend this place and will start going again at least 1 time a month .

Bad service had us leaving before our order was taken. We stood at the hostess table for nearly 5 minutes before anyone acknowledged us. Then the hostess tried to seat us in the bar. We asked for a different table and once we got there she threw the menus on the table and stomped away.  Then we sat for a long time and no one took our order. So we left.  Kind of disappointed.  The restaurant was only half full that night. The manager offered to help us out but, where was she when no one helped us at the hostess desk?

SOOOOOOO DISAPPOINTED!! It was only 9:30pm on a Friday night and the doors were locked. People were still waiting to be seated in the waiting area and while I jerked the door, the host standing at the desk indicated to me that they were closed for the rest of the night. Well that sucks balls! Because closing time is 11pm!

Very disappointed in this Red Robin location. I have been coming here since I was a little kid and usually the service is great. I don't know if they hired new staff or what but all I wanted to do was order to go. I called once and was on hold for 10 min. I hung up and called back and got put on hold for another 15 min. By that time, I reached the restaurant and went inside to place the order. It was another 15 minutes before anyone helped us and we had to ask again. I totally understand it's busy around dinner time but there was 4 people besides the hostess at the front. No one is capable of taking an order? No one thought "hmm. Let me check in with these people who have been standing here for 15 minutes and see if they've been helped" Ridiculous.

Red Robin likely gets a bad rep for being a chain restaurant at a time when chains are looked down upon.  However, like many chains currently, they have been doing a good job of trying to offer customers a strong value for what they get.  The bottomless fries (as well as a few other items which are offered bottomless) and reasonably priced burger offerings are what brought me into Red Robin on this trip.  On top of that, management does a good job of sending out frequent coupons through their rewards program.  The tavern burgers offer a nice variety of options at a competitive price, while there are larger, more premium burgers also available. If you sit at the bar, service is pretty reliable and friendly.  The milkshakes are tasty, the beer selection impressive, and you can watch a game while you eat should you choose.  All in all, a good experience at a good price.
Jessica was great and was very knowledgeable on the menu and we got the food fast even though it was busy!

My co-worker brought me an order of fish and chips. Limited amount of fries, the fish needed some seasoning but was good enough. No coleslaw in the box and I love coleslaw! Just one piece of ugly wilted lettuce. We have eaten at the restaurant and the same item was delicious. No more take out from Red Robin for me.
Horrible service. Waiting more than 30 minutes. According front desk. They were short of people. No customer service. Staff need more training. Never come again.

Always enjoy their burgers and fries. They have great Happy Hour prices on beer, $4.50 for a 22 oz bud light can't be beat ($3.50 for a pint) Their glasses and beer are always ICE COLD and taste fresh. The ROYAL is delicious. Bottomless fries are the bomb, can be a major gut buster if you don't control yourself. Service has always been great. Enjoyed the table top system to reorder drinks and pay. It even took my gift card!!! NOW - The ONLY bad experience I have ever had - The $5 chips, guac and salsa was awful. TINY PORTIONS, Stale chips, the gauc and salsa cam in the same little containers I get my side of ranch in. My small amount of chips ran out of gauc and salsa. That whole experience was disappointing, I mean chips and salsa are free in every Mexican rest so the "cost" must be insignificant, I understand limiting the Guac, but damn ... won't be ordering that again. Service was good!! First time ever disappointed in anything there.

Food actually was good I had the black and bleu burger and it was cooked to my liking. Although it didn't have a lot of seasoning there is the house seasoning on the table to indulge. Fries hot and fresh onion ring tower was good. Only complaint if you order the bottomless fries you should actually receive unlimited amounts we didn't. So I would actually give the food 4 stars for the quality. For me it's very pricey for burgers and fries $45 for two people is a bit much and this would be my only deterrent for not frequenting the joint.  Service really needs some help there should be someone at the wait desk when you walk in or else why have there? Server was a bit slow on the refill jump but I guess maybe because it was a Saturday night. Update... Recently revisited had the same thing and it did not tastes the same burger was flavorless cold fries. The service is horrible slow uninviting and for some reason the place just feels dirty and sticky. Needless to say I won't be back.

This was absolutely my worse experience I have ever had at any restaurant ever. Our waitress was ver nice and hard working but it took about 50 minutes if not longer for us to get our food and appetizers; and one item did not come out at all. It is very bad when paying customers are waiting for food and workers come out on break and have their food.  The managers even came out an met with each other while we were waiting for our food.  We were in the patio area because we had our puppy with us; all together there were approximately six tables in use and four were near the end of their meals.  I am not sure if more coverage was needed for that area or if our server was simply overwhelmed.  I am a rewards card member and I do not know if I will be back any time soon; I am writing this review in hopes the wait time will be improved for other patrons.  Also, a manager did come and apologize for the appetizer problem.

So unorganized! Our waitress was very sweet, but she was working practically alone. You know how frustrating it is to see employees sit down for their break and they get their food before you? Our appetizers were messed up but they did correct that before we even noticed. The apps came out with the entrees and we were so hungry by the time the food came, we didn't care. The BBQ chicken wrap used to be my "go to" item at Red Robin. It's no where near as tasty as it used to be. The mai tai I ordered, was the highlight of my meal. I should've just went to Islands next door.

Ugh. I am done with this place. Two pick up orders in the last month and they wore extremely late both times. The teenagers who work here try hard, but when I finally asked an older woman politely if my if she knew when my order would be ready, she snarled, no sir. I don't. If they were slammed, I would completely understand. But they just don't seem to be organized or interested.

Wow, all I can say.  I use to go to Red Robin in Calabases all the time as a kid and all I ever ordered was the Chicken Strips.  They were by far the best in town at the time. I just recently starting going to Red Robin as one opened up near my house after I moved to the South Bay and man, those new burgers, endless fries, service, everything across the board were delicious.  I have been probably 5 times since my first initially visit about a year ago and every time I am stunned by not just the price, but the quality.  I recently wrote a bad review about "Islands" as they are just night and day different in quality. Favorites in no particular order 1.  Bleu Ribbon  OR the Black & Blue (which is slightly better) 2. Whiskey River 3. Smoke & Pepper 5. Mushroom Burger 6.  Even the Crispy Arctic Cod is good! I honestly only get Burgers/ Sandwhiches from this place but I would assume most things are as equally delicious.  Honestly, I haven't really had anything I dont like.  The only downside is the stomach ache after you get from the Bottomless Fries, which you can swap out for any other kind once you finish your first bottomless fries.  Love the atmosphere, and the fast service.  5 stars.  Keep it up Red Robin!

Horrible service.. it's too bad I have to waste my time to write this review.. manager doesn't seem to care about complaints either.. this is probably the worst location out of 3 I visit. Lakewood Cerritos which closed recently and this location... Only offset is the burger. Good luck guys..
I always have a great experience here with the employees I receive tremendous customer service and my food is always fast and fresh !
This is the worst service ever!! Stay away from this place. Tons of tables open and they make you wait.
Much better service this time around. Polite server, good food and no issues using a gift card this time. Would go back.
Horrible. Please enroll in a English class so that you can learn how to talk to customers. Who says, "oh, the ranch ain't in there?" I'm done.

4 stars for a red robin?  yep! I usually come here to watch NBA games (go dubs!) at the bar area, the service is always great and they are great with the fries refills! I've gotten all sorts of burgers (including the cod burger) and a few salads and all are great! There is a bit of a wait at times so make sure you put your name down early if you have a larger party.

I love the food at Red Robin but have serious issues with how servers are treated when customers don't pay their bill and cheap people complain about their food so Red Robin will give them free food  All this poor cheap customers goes on record of servers who only did their jobs It's very sad that Red Robin doesn't have policy to protect the servers being shamed from false complaints from lying customers

They have terrible service, over an hour wait when it's literally not even busy, they are telling us "they aren't seating right now" what in the world is that about, if I could give them below a zero I would. It's ridiculous, as a team and the management they could have been on top of things for them not to look like an absolute fail, corporate should be contacted and they need to come together as a team and work towards success people are so mad that they are turning down service this is something I've never seen in my life.

Let me start off with saying the food is really good, and that's what most of the 5 star reviews are about on here. HOWEVER, i'm giving them a 1 star because the customer service is just awful. I went in on a Friday night - a wait for two people at 8:00pm was 20-25 minutes. Not bad. Until it turned out to be a 40 minute wait, and we arrived hungry. Once we finally got seated, a woman in a flowery shirt (the manager i'm assuming) took our drink order and told us our server will be right with us. She got our waters promptly and left. That was the last time any of the staff assisted us for a good 20-30 minutes. We waited and waited and waited, we didn't even know who our server was-- and guests who were seated AFTER us were already getting their food orders taken. I had to get up and let the manager know (who wasn't even paying attention to the floor, she was just mingling with the staff) that our server hasn't come in the past 30 minutes to take our orders. She then apologizes, and takes our order. She brings out a basket of fries with different sauces as an apology (which would've been nice, if we already didn't get bottomless fries with our burger). Finally our waitress, Shania, finally introduces herself, although she had passed our table a plenty amount of times while we were waiting to get our orders taken. I understand, she had a large party next to us, but if you can't handle that many people in your section maybe don't be a waiter??? It wasn't until AFTER the party left when she introduced herself.  The food was brought to the table and it was delicious we got the banzai burger and the sriracha tavern double, both came with bottomless steak fries. So with the fries from the manager, our actual meal with fries, Shania finally "tries" to be our waitress and brings us another basket of fries, ones that we don't want. We're already full, and irritated that the gesture just didn't seem enough anymore to redeem what little "good" customer service they had left. We didn't touch the basket, asked for the check and left. All in all, the food is pretty good here. However, if you come to this location, I recommend just getting take-out from here. We got there around 8, didn't finish until almost 10:30 because we waited so long. The managers really need to step it up here, pay attention to the floor, standing BEHIND the hostesses while chatting is not helping your establishment.

I took my son and my girlfriend here on Saturday night just to get out of the house and to redeem my free birthday burger.  We were greeted very warmly by the staff and were seated within 3 minutes of arriving.  Our waitress, Jessica I believe her name was, was very friendly and attentive to our table.  I ordered a southern barbecue burger and garlic fries and was quite pleased with the meat as well as the sauce and topping.  Everything was fresh, tasty and flavorful.  My girlfriend ordered a turkey burger and fries and my son ordered a grilled cheese with multiple servings of broccoli.  I ordered a couple of margaritas and Long Islands that night to wash down that wonderful burger.  My son topped his dinner off with a milkshake.  Although we were only inside eating briefly and they were about to close soon, everyone had a warm personality and seemed to love working there.

Would never come here again service is horrible.! My friend had an unknown thing on the rim of her cup that wouldn't come off and I politely asked a waitress if she can get us a new cup she said not right now and we waited 5 minutes before she came back ! On the upside the manager was really nice about everything or else this place would have gotten only one star

Came on here on 6/19/2017 for my free birthday burger server was Teresa we went just after opening. We even had the manager stop by and ask if we needed anything service was great!! Food was delish! Can't complain! I had the whiskey BBQ burger and we tried their siracha shrimp it's new it was good but a tad too spicy for me the hubs loved it and their bottomless steak fries are always the best!

I've gone back twice, but made sure to eat there. We're keto now and they actually offer a lettuce-wrapped burger on the menu. It's actually pretty good! I get it with a side salad to keep the carbs low. It still seemed a bit too busy for the number of servers, with a manager having to step in and help out, but it's much better than the Riverside location we used to frequent.

The food was decent and the service was good. The one thing I didn't like was that everything has a charge.  The endless fries were okay since I love french fries. I think the reason they give you endless fries is because the portion they give is small.  The burger was pretty good. The sauces are really good but you have to pay for each serving. Over all it was okay.

The food is still good at this location. They have a great staff and I love the, it's a great watering hole for locals and visitors alike. Shout out to Ky and Maria working the bar they are fun to be around. After all these years in the South Bay Red Robin still rocks !!

Tues evening burger date with my guy and we landed here. Burgers arent my go to meal, but when I have one it better be good.  Customer service was great. Waiter was attentive and had a sense of humor. The manager walked around tables to make sure  service was good. I ordered  the mushroom and swiss burger and it was good not the best Ive had, but decent. Meat was of okay grade. The sauteed mushrooms were delish and made the burger sooo good. The fries are bottomless and I wasnt excited. They give you a small amount of fries on the refill which will having you requesting a refill about 6 times for two people. Yep, we were given one basket of a small amount of fries to share between the two of us.  The fries didnt taste fresh, more so like a frozen bag of fries. They have different types of sauces for the fries  which is good and made the fries easy to eat.  The sauces cost so just be aware and dont go sauce crazy.  I will visit here again. The burger wasnt bad and my guy is so in love with fries he can eat anybodys fries, so the bottomless fry idea is perfect for him.

PERHAPS THE WORST MANAGED RESTAURANT I HAVE EVER BEEN TO!  While the food is usually OK I usually avoid this place due to our prior experiences there.  However, they are having a free milkshake promotion so my son really wanted to go. While the restaurant had dozens of empty tables we were told there was a wait and left our name. We waited while 3 greeters stood there folding menus and a manager wandered around. We were finally seated. We looked at the menu and waited to order. And waited and waited. The waitress finally came by 3 different times to say she'd be right with us. While we continued to wait we watched her standing in the bar watching a basketball game on TV. Finally she came over to take our drink order. Naturally my son ordered a milkshake. The response, "oh we're out of ice cream."  Really, you are running a free milkshake promotion and you are out of ice cream?!?!  We left. Inexcusably slow and poor service given the number of empty tables and the number of employees standing around. Obviously HORRIBLE management!!  We just left and we will not be back!

Unbelievable! Virtually empty & we are still waiting to be seated! 3 girls folding menus, waiters just walking around clueless. The only reason we're here is because my son likes it here. Will do my best to convince him otherwise. BTW - this was the Redondo Beach location in the Galleria. When we finally got a waitress to get our order (after saying she'd be right there three times), my son ordered a milkshake only to be told they didn't have any ice cream.  We walked out. 30 minutes wasted.

horrible service!!!!! so many times my family and I have dined there and have had things wrong with our order. Anything from our chicken sandwich not fully cooked or burger under cooked, things in our burger that were not requested ( my daughter had macaroni noodles in her burger when there should not have been noodles in it), etc... almost every time we come to this location we encounter issues!! and this last time I was there, the manager (I believe her name is Deborah) was so frikin rude to me and was loud enough to cause people to stare and for me to have to tell her to lower her voice!! the general manager ( a tall skinny man) stood not too far away watching this poor behavior by his manager and gave her the go ahead to be so frikin rude!! when I asked for the corporate office number, the manager refused to give it to me!!

I highly recommend this place. My fiance has celiac and it's very rare that he can find a great gluten free bun but this place really out does it when it comes to the gluten free buns! We come here often but today we got great service from McKenzie, she was kind, attentative and she knew where my obscure hat came from (emo nite) so that was very cool. The food was great and it came out very fast! Highly recommend! And I hope McKenzie gets some great recognition for the wonderful job she did today.

Jerrell gave me excellent customer service. He attended our table promptly. He was friendly and professional. This location is not too busy of a location. I enjoyed the food and always a nice bite to eat. Parkisng was easy to find as well.

Love this location and always have great service. The last two times we had Kate as our server. She went above and beyond for us. Food was great and look forward to going back. Will request Kate if she is available.

Service , Price, Food and atmosphere is great!  Rosie was our server and she was fantastic! She really accommodated us with customizing our order, kept the bottomless fries flowing continuously , I love not having to ask for a refill because your glass is always full.  The prices is extremely affordable!! My tab was 7 bucks for a delicious garment burger and bottomless fries (you can't find that no where) I ordered the Mac N Cheese burger which was absolutely delicious , if you like Mac n Cheese you definitely have to try it ! The fries is delicious very hot and especially fodn of the different sauces and seasoning options. I read the other reviews but I decided to try this location for myself had a very pleasant visit and will visit this location again whenever I'm in the area.

Been here twice so far, and both were good experiences. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food is here. I'm a vegetarian, so going to a burger place can be pretty scary. They have quite a few vegetarian friendly options, but my favorite is the siracha tavern burger with the Boca burger patty!  The last time I was here I ordered this new burger- it has spicy aoli, onion rings, cheddar cheese, pickles, lettuce and tomatoes. It was SO good, and paired perfectly with the yummy thick cut fries and Mich Ultra. They sent out the burger frozen, but quickly brought back a fresh, perfectly cooked one as soon as it was brought to their attention. My boyfriend loves the mac and cheese burger, unlimited fries, and all of the sauces. The onion rings are also pretty bomb. Definitely can't go there too often due to not wanting to kill my insides, but it's a nice treat every once in awhile.  I'll be back!

Food: 4/5 for chain casual  Service: 4/5 Khali (sp) at the bar was on it  Value: 5/5 unlimited fries Love coming here during my birth month for the free burger and unlimited steak fries :P Since I have a self proclaimed "black belt in French fries" I'll go on record and say islands unlimited fries don't even compare to Red Robin! Now I'm a little biased because I like my fries with meat (steak cut/wedges) over skinny (shoe string). Their unlimited steak fries are an excellent value!  Burgers are fresh & juicy and fairly priced. When you think about it, Red Robin might be one of the best burger restaurants as far as value, RIGHT NOW!  We've been to this location the past (2) Julys and left happy (full) each time. Mac and cheese burger was solid (not that much pasta on it as the photo). You can't go wrong with any burger just choose based on what you're craving. The vegetarian boca burger is also tasty.  Only negative is sometimes it takes a while to get greeted when you sit in the bar. We moved to the bar stools and received excellent service! Will be back :)

I order some burger for Togo  omg this it's ready bad idea. Worst burger I ever get never again fríes really cool and old burger ingredients everywhere really nasty experience never place order to go here

WORST. SERVICE. EVER.  Our party of 12 waited for 30 minutes to be seated - which was fine.  When we were seated, our waitress Bree, stood at the computer for 15 minutes while we waited.  She finally came to take our drink and food order BUT took her time to do everything.  Every time we looked for her, she was standing at the computer.  Either she needs better training or she should not be serving parties over 4.   Half of our party was served their food and then the other half came 20 minutes later.    I will NEVER come to this location EVER again.

They input order wrong even after repeating it correctly on phone, then I had to sit there while they only charged me half for my missing item -- meanwhile the rest of my food got cold , the manager meanwhile was making kid smoothies behind the bar and cracking jokes - the meager $3 off they gave me is the only reason not one star

Took my grand daughter here for her birthday and I honestly couldn't run out of there fast enough my husband had a long black curly hair in his food on top of that we saw the waitress one time ! This place has the worse customer service and always have but I understand things get busy kept giving them chances BUT now hair in their food !!? I WILL NEVER EVER EVER RETURN TO Red Robin again ! I paid through their little table kiosk thing and took off ! There service on top of hair in the food made this a awful experience I didn't even bother to tell them to sing happy birthday very disappointed but I know now to never come back .

I see where this place can get its bad reviews. It was a hit or miss with us. Our first waiter was not pleasent. But apparently he was on the way out. Got a replacement lady. Super helpful and very caring.  Got two burgers and kids chicken tenders.  Fire Burger thing was good. I got it with chicken and it had the Chipotle flavor. Not spicy at all.  so don't be afraid of it. Was good. Not memorable to say. But satisfies the hunger.  Salmon Burger was GREAT. Deff something I'd get again if I ever came back. Not dry Salmon. Perfectly cooked and very flavorful. Makes you feel like you don't want it to end.  Endless fries are nice. Not a big fan of them but the kids liked them. Chicken tenders were dry. Kids had a hard time chewing them. So that didnt get finished.  Besides that we were offered more fries.  But we can't because we were so full.   Never ending Rootbeer Float is a must if you like it. I do! Hard time transfering root beer into the ice cream mug. But it got easier with a less full cup.  Bathrooms were ok and unbussed tables. Meh. Enoy and Stay Wild!

Left us waiting over 40 mins for a pick up order the hostess had a attitude when I asked if pick up order would be ready soon and she went in the back and brought it out seems like it was ready and just had me sitting there I order regularly from here and never had this problem bad service
Marvelous restaurant that never fails to impress me. Tasty food and exquisite cuisine. Delicious gourmet burgers always and forever.

Hate to write this review, but I had the new citrus Harissa salmon burger.  Along with broccoli and fries.  Wound up with food poisoning.  No more ordering salmon here for me, but I've never had a problem with the burgers.  Don't plan to order the broccoli again either.  Did inform the restaurant.  It is a little hard to pay for food when you wind up sick from it, Well, as of 09/11/17, I just can't bring myself to eat here again.  Miserable experience where I took a week to get back to normal.  Now I'm afraid to eat here after I was so sick.  Food poisoning does not make this place an attractive place for any future meals.

Worst place to eat, not clean or the food fresh. They made me get bottomless fries and they get like 10 to 15 pieces of fries and every refill takes over 10 mins. The server was horrible she didn't offer water or any drinks, screwup our small order too.

This is our favorite burger place. Of course we have to get the endless steak fries with the special seasoning. Ricardo was the best server ever, refilling our drinks and fries with friendly efficiency. Can't wait to go back!

This is my go to Burger restaurant! Staff is always friendly, funny and bubbly. Love their burgers & bottomless steak fries with their special season salt. Great options- veggie or turkey burgers and chicken sandwiches. Great place to have birthday dinners - sign up for their Rewards club to get a free birthday burger during your birthday month. There was only 1 time I wasn't satisfied with the food - the poutine fries were a little disappointing - too salty and the cheese looked like it was just melted sliced cheese. Other than that everything else I've had was delicious! No maybe it isn't the fanciest place but it's comfy, fun and laid-back with good food, good deals and good drinks. Can't go wrong!

I loved Red Robin, but their food quality and customer service has significantly decreased. I have been a few time during the last six months. My last visit was for my son's birthday. We found a huge roach on the floor. When we mentioned it to the server he did nothing so my sister asked to speak with the manager. The manger said "oh I've never see a bug here. This is the first time", doubtful. We immediately left without eating our food. I will never return to this location it is completely dirty and needs new management.

Red Robins is not that great. I would not recommend trying them out to anyone who asks. The last time I was here service was extremely bad, our meals were often delayed and for the price, the portions were very small. The only highlight was the fries, but for a restaurant that boasts that their burgers are the best, this one was very dry and tasteless. I expected much more and was left with this appointment. I will not be going there anytime soon.

we first ordered clucks and shrimp.  we arrived to the restaurant around 8pm.  sorry they are all out of the clucks, which are simply chicken strips.  so he ordered the raspberry lemonade and just a basket of shrimp with the bottomless steak fries.  he not one time got a refill on those fries and for the refill on the lemonade which ended up being strawberry instead of lemonade was hard to get as well.  he even held out his glass and followed the waiter Dave (i think his name was, who by the way must have been his 2nd day or he was tired or late going home or something but he just did not care and was slow) with the glass but still no refill.  i ordered a simple hamburger with the steak fries.  the next day i had a slight case of food poisoning.  i nor will my friend be going back to this red robin or any other ones.

I got the BBQ Boss Hog burger. The pulled pork bbq wasn't pulled enough for my liking. It was in one big clump, not spread across the burger evenly. The bbq sauce was nice and sweet though. The burger was well done but still juicy. The jalapeño kaiser roll tasted nothing like jalapeño. The onion straws I got on the side were wet and limp, not crispy. They did give me new ones which were better. Our server was Rosie. She was nice and attentive. The restaurant is clean, large, always busy, and has lots of glass windows.

Tavern Tuesdays and free birthday burgers, yay!  And bottomless steak fries too.  Beyond that, I don't have much more to give more than three stars to.  First, I am not a carnivore so, I have depended on my sweetie's opinions on the tavern burger.  We are on the email list so, we get the alerts whenever there is a free burger avaliable at Red Robin. From the photo, the Tavern burger looks pretty good and I was informed how great a burger it is.  For me, all I'm able to have as far as burgers go, is the veggie burger.  I can get any version burger with a veggie patty.  I usually go with something like bbq or something  with a flavorful sauce otherwise regular condiments on a veggie patty is quite bland as their veggie patties are just OK. Love the bottomless steak fries!  Can't complain. Service is hit or miss.  It's a corporate mall chain burger joint so, just a 3 star review for my 1 to 2 visits a year.

I haven't been to Red Robin in a while. I went because of the Special Olympics fundraiser. What a pleasant surprise!!! The food was soooo yummy!! And endless fries!! I love that the menu shows you easy ways to make the meals healthier and lower in calories!!!' Wonderful, Big TVs. I was able to watch the NLCS playoffs. What a great night

HAPPY hour is on selected draft beer only. I tried the margarita. .it's full of ice and more juice...  The only thing I like is the bottomless garlic fries. The burger is yummy. .flavored  service is good when it's slow..

I had the bruscheta chicken sandwich and it was absolutely perfect. Really delicious, I would highly recommend it. Plus Red Robin always has unlimited fries which is always nice :) My friend had the veggie burger and she said it was really tasty. We both walked away satisfied and happy with our meals.
Had really good burgers and fries. Sara J our server was very attentive. We were very happy.

We come to this Red Robin quite often. It is conveniently located in the South Bay Galleria mall. We like the burgers and bottomless sides. It's reliably better than Johnny Rockets by a long moon shot.  Hubby and I enjoy the Red Robin Tavern, the guacamole and bacon burger and the Pesto Chicken burger. We also like to personalize our burgers with ciabatta bread and fresh jalapeños.  The kids meals are great deals! My toddlers love these meals. About $4.50-$6.00 for an entree (cod fritter, chicken tender, grilled chicken breast, meatballs, pizza, mac n cheese...), a bottomless side (fries, broccoli, corn, apples, fruit medley...) and a drink (milk, chocolate milk, lemonade, fountain drink). Serving size seems good enough for a 9-10 year old, as long as they get a refill or two on the bottomless size. A 12 year old may still be hungry with these portion sizes.  Given how much we love this place, why not a 5-star review? Service is spotty. Bottomless sides are not refilled all that frequently- seems the restaurant is chronically understaffed with just one waitress for a dozen tables. Also, some of the patrons are on the Ghetto size - I get that this is just the demographics of this mall but it sometimes makes eating here uncomfortable.  The Red Robin Rewards program provides coupons and frequent diners free burgers (10th burger free). Plus, a free burger on your birthday.  South Bay Galleria Mall gift cards also accepted here!

(huge sigh) I really wanted to like this place. After receiving such great service last time amd tasty burgers and fries I decided to come back. I have returned twice and have been disappointed both times. The service was mediocre. My friend and I sat at the bar area and we received no service. After 15 minutes of just sitting I was ready to walk out, but my friend waved another waiter down who then told us someone would be right with us. We ended up waiting another 10 minutes and a young lady came over and took our orders. We ordered the chili cheese fries (after I warned my friend they aren't good) as well as fries, and fried pickles. We enjoyed everything except the chili cheese fries. We tasted almost no chili. Red Robin should call them cheese fries b/c that's all we tasted. Against my better judgement I came back and ordered the Banzi burger. It was absolutely awful. The pineapple tasted and looked old. There was just a pinch of teriyaki sauce on the burger. I ordered the burger thinking it would taste like the Maui burger at Islands, I was wrong. Oh and service again was reaaaaaaaaaaaaaally slow. It wasn't even crowded. I won't be returning.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Best costumer service I had  here I place a order online and it was the quickest!!!! Love their employees they are so nice and very profesional  I think I might want to start coming more often and eat here!!!!!!! A five star restaurant

Great place to chill before or after shopping at the mall. During Xmas time I go multiple times per month. The bartenders are all super friendly and very attentive, especially Maria. The burger was a little dry last week but I will continue to go as the staff are amazing.

We stopped here for lunch while doing some holiday shopping. At first I was worried that we would have a long wait for a table because it was a very busy time of year and the restaurant looked pretty full, but we were seated in under 10 minutes. Their menu is great; standard American fare, fun appetizers and burgers, chicken, some fish, etc. so there is something for everyone. We had the tower of onion ring appetizer (best onion rings I've ever had, no joke) and then we all got something different for lunch. Everything was delicious, our server brought our meals out quickly and was attentive even though it was busy. Service and food both excellent. Red Robin never disappoints.

After a a few hours of shopping for Christmas inside the mall, I worked up an appetite and was really craving for something that would satisfy my stomach. It was either Panera, California Pizza Kitchen, or Red Robin. I'm glad I chose Red Robin!  Their bottomless fries and symmetrical art work is everything and a half! Oh, and their Crispy Chicken Sandwich is almost as good as another famous Chicken Sandwich spot I know of.  The staff is so friendly. They were quick to bring out the food and drinks but wasn't on their game about providing utensils and napkins before hand. Had to wait a few bites until I realized I was missing those items. But once I asked them for it, they immediately brought it over in milliseconds. I think the self pay kiosk at the tables is a very clever way to eliminate any billing issues. I know some people are adamant about paying for the things they order and so this kiosk relieves some of that stress and tension.  Overall, good food and a great place to dine and meet up for drinks.

Got my free birthday burger here! I don't remember this place the same as dreamy as I did in college, guess my standards have changed. I do love the booth seating and the online iPad ordering. The burgers are not juicy though or as large as those gourmet burgers, it's a step above an average burger you could make yourself at home. The steak fries are alright too, maybe adding the garlic is necessary for a $1.50 extra. I like this place since it's a good deal and it's great to bring kids and you can stay for hours and chat but that's about it. Also, our waitress wasn't as bad as others have quoted as the service being terrible, thought service was pretty good.

I stopped by with my friends and family on Christmas Eve and was pleasantly surprised at how good the service was. Our server was Jerrell and he was very attentive, polite and friendly the whole time we were there. He made sure to stop by every few minutes to be sure we were okay and was quick to refill our beverages. All our food was very good, we ordered the ensenada chicken plate, soup & salad, simply grilled chicken salad and the BLTA sandwich and they were all good as was our cinnamon donuts tower dessert.
I toyed this restaurant before and service is as slow as the turtles and sucks the employees don't have any shame

This review is for grub hub delivery which I used for the first time never again , I go here every week for fish n chips and wings delivery driver great, fish and chips would not let me order without ordering a side I ordered side salad I got fish and side salad ...? Grub hub refunded fries for $2.00 if I wanted fish and salad I would have ordered from a fish restaurant first and last time with grub hub I also did not get dips I ordered they were on grub hub order but not on Red Robin order .Red robin would be better just using other delivery service

When you really want that good fries fix and have a decent burger along with those fries, Red Robin's the solution. Not too far from home, my wife and I consider RR a treat when we just want to stuff ourselves silly with fries. The burgers are slightly better than just an average burger. Sure, it's good, but it's not amazing. Wife and I always get the tavern burgers as that's the best bang for buck. Reason I gave a 3 rather than 4 or 5 is because it's always a crap shoot when it comes service at this particular RR. We've had some servers seemingly disappear on us for a whole meal service, servers showing partiality in service to other tables based off appearances, and servers that nickle and dime us with charges for items that weren't previously noted that we'd be charged for - so watch out for those random misc charges when you get your check. Pros: Bottomless fries Bottomless strawberry lemonade Nice assortment of complimentary dipping sauces for the fries Cons:  Service could be poor
